lastViewedByMeDate.description: Last time this file was viewed by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

appDataContents.description: Whether this file is in the appdata folder.

thumbnailLink.description: A link to the file's thumbnail.

labels.description: A group of labels for the file.

restricted.description: Whether viewers are prevented from downloading this file.

trashed.description: Whether this file has been trashed.

starred.description: Whether this file is starred by the user.

viewed.description: Whether this file has been viewed by this user.

indexableText.description: Indexable text attributes for the file (can only be written)

text.description: The text to be indexed for this file.

explicitlyTrashed.description: Whether this file has been explicitly trashed, as opposed to recursively trashed. This will only be populated if the file is trashed.

etag.description: ETag of the file.

lastModifyingUserName.description: Name of the last user to modify this file.

writersCanShare.description: Whether writers can share the document with other users.

sharedWithMeDate.description: Time at which this file was shared with the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

sharingUser.description: User that shared the item with the current user, if available.

lastModifyingUser.description: The last user to modify this file.

copyable.description: Whether the file can be copied by the current user.

ownerNames.description: Name(s) of the owner(s) of this file.

id.description: The ID of the file.

webViewLink.description: A link only available on public folders for viewing their static web assets (HTML, CSS, JS, etc) via Google Drive's Website Hosting.

version.description: A monotonically increasing version number for the file. This reflects every change made to the file on the server, even those not visible to the requesting user.

parents.description:
Collection of parent folders which contain this file.
Setting this field will put the file in all of the provided folders. On insert, if no folders are provided, the file will be placed in the default root folder.

additionalProperties.description: A mapping from export format to URL

exportLinks.description: Links for exporting Google Docs to specific formats.

shared.description: Whether the file has been shared.

iconLink.description: A link to the file's icon.

thumbnail.description: Thumbnail for the file. Only accepted on upload and for files that are not already thumbnailed by Google.

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the thumbnail.

image.description: The URL-safe Base64 encoded bytes of the thumbnail image.

openWithLinks.description: A map of the id of each of the user's apps to a link to open this file with that app. Only populated when the drive.apps.readonly scope is used.

defaultOpenWithLink.description: A link to open this file with the user's default app for this file. Only populated when the drive.apps.readonly scope is used.

description.description: A short description of the file.

webContentLink.description: A link for downloading the content of the file in a browser using cookie based authentication. In cases where the content is shared publicly, the content can be downloaded without any credentials.

editable.description: Whether the file can be edited by the current user.

kind.description: The type of file. This is always drive#file.

embedLink.description: A link for embedding the file.

markedViewedByMeDate.description: Time this file was explicitly marked viewed by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

fileExtension.description: The file extension used when downloading this file. This field is read only. To set the extension, include it in the title when creating the file. This is only populated for files with content stored in Drive.

fileSize.description: The size of the file in bytes. This is only populated for files with content stored in Drive.

createdDate.description: Create time for this file (formatted ISO8601 timestamp).

md5Checksum.description: An MD5 checksum for the content of this file. This is populated only for files with content stored in Drive.

permissions.description: The list of permissions for users with access to this file.

imageMediaMetadata.description: Metadata about image media. This will only be present for image types, and its contents will depend on what can be parsed from the image content.

exposureBias.description: The exposure bias of the photo (APEX value).

exposureTime.description: The length of the exposure, in seconds.

flashUsed.description: Whether a flash was used to create the photo.

cameraMake.description: The make of the camera used to create the photo.

width.description: The width of the image in pixels.

focalLength.description: The focal length used to create the photo, in millimeters.

exposureMode.description: The exposure mode used to create the photo.

colorSpace.description: The color space of the photo.

subjectDistance.description: The distance to the subject of the photo, in meters.

height.description: The height of the image in pixels.

lens.description: The lens used to create the photo.

date.description: The date and time the photo was taken (EXIF format timestamp).

meteringMode.description: The metering mode used to create the photo.

location.description: Geographic location information stored in the image.

latitude.description: The latitude stored in the image.

altitude.description: The altitude stored in the image.

longitude.description: The longitude stored in the image.

isoSpeed.description: The ISO speed used to create the photo.

rotation.description: The rotation in clockwise degrees from the image's original orientation.

cameraModel.description: The model of the camera used to create the photo.

sensor.description: The type of sensor used to create the photo.

whiteBalance.description: The white balance mode used to create the photo.

aperture.description: The aperture used to create the photo (f-number).

maxApertureValue.description: The smallest f-number of the lens at the focal length used to create the photo (APEX value).

alternateLink.description: A link for opening the file in using a relevant Google editor or viewer.

modifiedByMeDate.description: Last time this file was modified by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). Note that setting modifiedDate will also update the modifiedByMe date for the user which set the date.

downloadUrl.description: Short lived download URL for the file. This is only populated for files with content stored in Drive.

userPermission.description: The permissions for the authenticated user on this file.

originalFilename.description: The original filename if the file was uploaded manually, or the original title if the file was inserted through the API. Note that renames of the title will not change the original filename. This will only be populated on files with content stored in Drive.

quotaBytesUsed.description: The number of quota bytes used by this file.

headRevisionId.description: The ID of the file's head revision. This will only be populated for files with content stored in Drive.

selfLink.description: A link back to this file.

modifiedDate.description: Last time this file was modified by anyone (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). This is only mutable on update when the setModifiedDate parameter is set.

PermissionList.description: A list of permissions associated with a file.

kind.description: This is always drive#permissionList.

etag.description: The ETag of the list.

selfLink.description: A link back to this list.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

title: Drive API

insert.description: Insert a new file.

convert.description: Whether to convert this file to the corresponding Google Docs format.

useContentAsIndexableText.description: Whether to use the content as indexable text.

ocrLanguage.description: If ocr is true, hints at the language to use. Valid values are ISO 639-1 codes.

visibility.description: The visibility of the new file. This parameter is only relevant when convert=false.
enumDescriptions: The visibility of the new file is determined by the user's default visibility/sharing policies.
The new file will be visible to only the owner.

pinned.description: Whether to pin the head revision of the uploaded file.

ocr.description: Whether to attempt OCR on .jpg, .png, .gif, or .pdf uploads.

timedTextLanguage.description: The language of the timed text.

untrash.description: Restores a file from the trash.

fileId.description: The ID of the file to untrash.

copy.description: Creates a copy of the specified file.

ocrLanguage.description: If ocr is true, hints at the language to use. Valid values are ISO 639-1 codes.

The new file will be visible to only the owner.

pinned.description: Whether to pin the head revision of the new copy.

ocr.description: Whether to attempt OCR on .jpg, .png, .gif, or .pdf uploads.

timedTextLanguage.description: The language of the timed text.

fileId.description: The ID of the file to copy.

updateViewedDate.description: Whether to update the view date after successfully retrieving the file.

projection.description: This parameter is deprecated and has no function.

fileId.description: The ID for the file in question.

list.description: Lists the user's files.

pageToken.description: Page token for files.

corpus.description: The body of items (files/documents) to which the query applies.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of files to return.

watch.description: Subscribe to changes on a file

projection.description: This parameter is deprecated and has no function.

fileId.description: The ID for the file in question.

update.description: Updates file metadata and/or content.

convert.description: Whether to convert this file to the corresponding Google Docs format.

ocr.description: Whether to attempt OCR on .jpg, .png, .gif, or .pdf uploads.

removeParents.description: Comma-separated list of parent IDs to remove.

fileId.description: The ID of the file to update.

useContentAsIndexableText.description: Whether to use the content as indexable text.

addParents.description: Comma-separated list of parent IDs to add.

newRevision.description: Whether a blob upload should create a new revision. If false, the blob data in the current head revision is replaced. If not set or true, a new blob is created as head revision, and previous revisions are preserved (causing increased use of the user's data storage quota).

ocrLanguage.description: If ocr is true, hints at the language to use. Valid values are ISO 639-1 codes.

pinned.description: Whether to pin the new revision.

setModifiedDate.description: Whether to set the modified date with the supplied modified date.

updateViewedDate.description: Whether to update the view date after successfully updating the file.

timedTextLanguage.description: The language of the timed text.

patch.description: Updates file metadata and/or content. This method supports patch semantics.

convert.description: Whether to convert this file to the corresponding Google Docs format.

ocr.description: Whether to attempt OCR on .jpg, .png, .gif, or .pdf uploads.

removeParents.description: Comma-separated list of parent IDs to remove.

fileId.description: The ID of the file to update.

emptyTrash.description: Permanently deletes all of the user's trashed files.

touch.description: Set the file's updated time to the current server time.

fileId.description: The ID of the file to update.

trash.description: Moves a file to the trash.

fileId.description: The ID of the file to trash.

delete.description: Permanently deletes a file by ID. Skips the trash.

fileId.description: The ID of the file to delete.

get.description: Gets the information about the current user along with Drive API settings

includeSubscribed.description: When calculating the number of remaining change IDs, whether to include public files the user has opened and shared files. When set to false, this counts only change IDs for owned files and any shared or public files that the user has explicitly added to a folder they own.

maxChangeIdCount.description: Maximum number of remaining change IDs to count

startChangeId.description: Change ID to start counting from when calculating number of remaining change IDs

update.description: Overwrites the Realtime API data model associated with this file with the provided JSON data model.

baseRevision.description: The revision of the model to diff the uploaded model against. If set, the uploaded model is diffed against the provided revision and those differences are merged with any changes made to the model after the provided revision. If not set, the uploaded model replaces the current model on the server.

fileId.description: The ID of the file that the Realtime API data model is associated with.

get.description: Exports the contents of the Realtime API data model associated with this file as JSON.

fileId.description: The ID of the file that the Realtime API data model is associated with.

revision.description: The revision of the Realtime API data model to export. Revisions start at 1 (the initial empty data model) and are incremented with each change. If this parameter is excluded, the most recent data model will be returned.

list.description: Lists a user's installed apps.

languageCode.description: A language or locale code, as defined by BCP 47, with some extensions from Unicode's LDML format (http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr35/).

appFilterExtensions.description: A comma-separated list of file extensions for open with filtering. All apps within the given app query scope which can open any of the given file extensions will be included in the response. If appFilterMimeTypes are provided as well, the result is a union of the two resulting app lists.

appFilterMimeTypes.description: A comma-separated list of MIME types for open with filtering. All apps within the given app query scope which can open any of the given MIME types will be included in the response. If appFilterExtensions are provided as well, the result is a union of the two resulting app lists.

get.description: Gets a specific app.

insert.description: Creates a new comment on the given file.

get.description: Gets a comment by ID.

includeDeleted.description: If set, this will succeed when retrieving a deleted comment, and will include any deleted replies.

list.description: Lists a file's comments.

pageToken.description: The continuation token, used to page through large result sets. To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of "nextPageToken" from the previous response.

includeDeleted.description: If set, all comments and replies, including deleted comments and replies (with content stripped) will be returned.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of discussions to include in the response, used for paging.

updatedMin.description: Only discussions that were updated after this timestamp will be returned. Formatted as an RFC 3339 timestamp.

update.description: Updates an existing comment.

patch.description: Updates an existing comment. This method supports patch semantics.

insert.description: Inserts a file into a folder.

delete.description: Removes a child from a folder.

list.description: Lists a folder's children.

pageToken.description: Page token for children.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of children to return.

get.description: Gets a specific child reference.

stop.description: Stop watching resources through this channel

insert.description: Adds a parent folder for a file.

delete.description: Removes a parent from a file.

list.description: Lists a file's parents.

get.description: Gets a specific parent reference.

insert.description: Creates a new reply to the given comment.

get.description: Gets a reply.

includeDeleted.description: If set, this will succeed when retrieving a deleted reply.

list.description: Lists all of the replies to a comment.

includeDeleted.description: If set, all replies, including deleted replies (with content stripped) will be returned.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of replies to include in the response, used for paging.

pageToken.description: The continuation token, used to page through large result sets. To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of "nextPageToken" from the previous response.

update.description: Updates an existing reply.

patch.description: Updates an existing reply. This method supports patch semantics.

insert.description: Inserts a permission for a file.

emailMessage.description: A custom message to include in notification emails.

sendNotificationEmails.description: Whether to send notification emails when sharing to users or groups. This parameter is ignored and an email is sent if the role is owner.

get.description: Gets a permission by ID.

getIdForEmail.description: Returns the permission ID for an email address.

email.description: The email address for which to return a permission ID

list.description: Lists a file's permissions.

update.description: Updates a permission.

transferOwnership.description: Whether changing a role to 'owner' should also downgrade the current owners to writers.

patch.description: Updates a permission. This method supports patch semantics.

transferOwnership.description: Whether changing a role to 'owner' should also downgrade the current owners to writers.

delete.description: Deletes a permission from a file.

list.description: Lists the changes for a user.

includeSubscribed.description: Whether to include public files the user has opened and shared files. When set to false, the list only includes owned files plus any shared or public files the user has explicitly added to a folder they own.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of changes to return.

startChangeId.description: Change ID to start listing changes from.

pageToken.description: Page token for changes.

watch.description: Subscribe to changes for a user.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of changes to return.

startChangeId.description: Change ID to start listing changes from.

pageToken.description: Page token for changes.

get.description: Gets a specific change.

list.description: Lists a file's properties.

update.description: Updates a property.

description: The API to interact with Drive.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.description: View and manage the files and documents in your Google Drive

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.re.description: View the files and documents in your Google Drive

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.fi.description: View and manage Google Drive files that you have opened or created with this app

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.sc.description: Modify your Google Apps Script scripts' behavior

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.me.description: View metadata for files and documents in your Google Drive

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.ap.description: View and manage its own configuration data in your Google Drive

name: drive

candidate.description: If filled, then the listed candidates are potential matches, and such should be evaluated by a more discerning algorithm or human. The matches are ordered by confidence.

match.description: If filled, this entity is guaranteed to match at requested confidence probability (default 99%).

StyleSettingList.description: Represents a list of styles for a given table.

nextPageToken.description: Token used to access the next page of this result. No token is displayed if there are no more styles left.

kind.description: Type name: in this case, a list of style settings.

totalItems.description: Total number of styles for the table.

Sqlresponse.description: Represents a response to an sql statement.

kind.description: Type name: a template for an individual table.

rows.description: The rows in the table. For each cell we print out whatever cell value (e.g., numeric, string) exists. Thus it is important that each cell contains only one value.

PointStyle.description: Represents a PointStyle within a StyleSetting

iconStyler.description: Column or a bucket value from which the icon name is to be determined.

iconName.description: Name of the icon. Use values defined in http://www.google.com/fusiontables/DataSource?dsrcid=308519

type.description: Type: A polygon geometry.

coordinates.description: The coordinates that define the polygon.

type.description: Point: A point geometry.

coordinates.description: The coordinates that define the point.

Column.description: Specifies the id, name and type of a column in a table.

kind.description: Type name: a template for an individual column.

baseColumn.description: Optional identifier of the base column. If present, this column is derived from the specified base column.

tableIndex.description: Offset to the entry in the list of base tables in the table definition.

columnId.description: The id of the column in the base table from which this column is derived.

graph_predicate.description: Optional column predicate. Used to map table to graph data model (subject,predicate,object) See http://www.w3.org/TR/2014/REC-rdf11-concepts-20140225/#data-model

type.description: Required type of the column.

description.description: Optional column description.

PolygonStyle.description: Represents a PolygonStyle within a StyleSetting

strokeColorStyler.description: Column-value, gradient or buckets styler that is used to determine the border color and opacity.

strokeWeight.description: Width of the polyon border in pixels.

strokeOpacity.description: Opacity of the polygon border: 0.0 (transparent) to 1.0 (opaque).

strokeWeightStyler.description: Column-value or bucket styler that is used to determine the width of the polygon border.

fillColorStyler.description: Column-value, gradient, or bucket styler that is used to determine the interior color and opacity of the polygon.

fillColor.description: Color of the interior of the polygon in #RRGGBB format.

strokeColor.description: Color of the polygon border in #RRGGBB format.

fillOpacity.description: Opacity of the interior of the polygon: 0.0 (transparent) to 1.0 (opaque).

Bucket.description: Specifies the minimum and maximum values, the color, opacity, icon and weight of a bucket within a StyleSetting.

min.description: Minimum value in the selected column for a row to be styled according to the bucket color, opacity, icon, or weight.

color.description: Color of line or the interior of a polygon in #RRGGBB format.

max.description: Maximum value in the selected column for a row to be styled according to the bucket color, opacity, icon, or weight.

icon.description: Icon name used for a point.

nextPageToken.description: Token used to access the next page of this result. No token is displayed if there are no more tokens left.

kind.description: Type name: a list of all tables.

StyleFunction.description: Represents a StyleFunction within a StyleSetting

gradient.description: Gradient function that interpolates a range of colors based on column value.

max.description: Higher-end of the interpolation range: rows with this value will be assigned to colors[n-1].

colors.description: Array with two or more colors.

min.description: Lower-end of the interpolation range: rows with this value will be assigned to colors[0].

columnName.description: Name of the column whose value is used in the style.

buckets.description: Bucket function that assigns a style based on the range a column value falls into.

kind.description: Stylers can be one of three kinds: "fusiontables#fromColumn" if the column value is to be used as is, i.e., the column values can have colors in #RRGGBBAA format or integer line widths or icon names; "fusiontables#gradient" if the styling of the row is to be based on applying the gradient function on the column value; or "fusiontables#buckets" if the styling is to based on the bucket into which the the column value falls.

type.description: Type: A collection of geometries.

geometries.description: The list of geometries in this geometry collection.

TemplateList.description: Represents a list of templates for a given table.

nextPageToken.description: Token used to access the next page of this result. No token is displayed if there are no more tokens left.

kind.description: Type name: a list of all templates.

totalItems.description: Total number of templates for the table.

Template.description: Represents the contents of InfoWindow templates.

body.description: Body of the template. It contains HTML with {column_name} to insert values from a particular column. The body is sanitized to remove certain tags, e.g., script. Only one of body or automaticColumns can be specified.

kind.description: Type name: a template for the info window contents. The template can either include an HTML body or a list of columns from which the template is computed automatically.

name.description: Optional name assigned to a template.

automaticColumnNames.description: List of columns from which the template is to be automatically constructed. Only one of body or automaticColumns can be specified.

tableId.description: Identifier for the table for which the template is defined.

templateId.description: Identifier for the template, unique within the context of a particular table.

numRowsReceived.description: The number of rows received from the import request.

kind.description: Type name: a template for an import request.

ColumnList.description: Represents a list of columns in a table.

nextPageToken.description: Token used to access the next page of this result. No token is displayed if there are no more tokens left.

kind.description: Type name: a list of all columns.

totalItems.description: Total number of columns for the table.

Table.description: Represents a table. Specifies the name, whether it is exportable, description, attribution, and attribution link.

kind.description: Type name: a template for an individual table.

attribution.description: Optional attribution assigned to the table.

description.description: Optional description assigned to the table.

isExportable.description: Variable for whether table is exportable.

baseTableIds.description: Optional base table identifier if this table is a view or merged table.

sql.description: Optional sql that encodes the table definition for derived tables.

tableId.description: Encrypted unique alphanumeric identifier for the table.

type.description: Type: A line geometry.

coordinates.description: The coordinates that define the line.

LineStyle.description: Represents a LineStyle within a StyleSetting

strokeWeight.description: Width of the line in pixels.

strokeWeightStyler.description: Column-value or bucket styler that is used to determine the width of the line.

strokeColor.description: Color of the line in #RRGGBB format.

strokeColorStyler.description: Column-value, gradient or buckets styler that is used to determine the line color and opacity.

StyleSetting.description: Represents a complete StyleSettings object. The primary key is a combination of the tableId and a styleId.

markerOptions.description: Style definition for points in the table.

kind.description: Type name: an individual style setting. A StyleSetting contains the style defintions for points, lines, and polygons in a table. Since a table can have any one or all of them, a style definition can have point, line and polygon style definitions.

name.description: Optional name for the style setting.

polygonOptions.description: Style definition for polygons in the table.

polylineOptions.description: Style definition for lines in the table.

tableId.description: Identifier for the table.

styleId.description: Identifier for the style setting (unique only within tables).

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

title: Fusion Tables API

insert.description: Adds a new column to the table.

tableId.description: Table for which a new column is being added.

get.description: Retrieves a specific column by its id.

tableId.description: Table to which the column belongs.

columnId.description: Name or identifier for the column that is being requested.

list.description: Retrieves a list of columns.

pageToken.description: Continuation token specifying which result page to return. Optional.

tableId.description: Table whose columns are being listed.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of columns to return. Optional. Default is 5.

update.description: Updates the name or type of an existing column.

tableId.description: Table for which the column is being updated.

columnId.description: Name or identifier for the column that is being updated.

patch.description: Updates the name or type of an existing column. This method supports patch semantics.

tableId.description: Table for which the column is being updated.

columnId.description: Name or identifier for the column that is being updated.

tableId.description: Table from which the column is being deleted.

columnId.description: Name or identifier for the column being deleted.

typed.description: Should typed values be returned in the (JSON) response -- numbers for numeric values and parsed geometries for KML values? Default is true.

hdrs.description: Should column names be included (in the first row)?. Default is true.

typed.description: Should typed values be returned in the (JSON) response -- numbers for numeric values and parsed geometries for KML values? Default is true.

hdrs.description: Should column names be included (in the first row)?. Default is true.

insert.description: Adds a new style for the table.

tableId.description: Table for which a new style is being added

get.description: Gets a specific style.

tableId.description: Table to which the requested style belongs

styleId.description: Identifier (integer) for a specific style in a table

list.description: Retrieves a list of styles.

pageToken.description: Continuation token specifying which result page to return. Optional.

tableId.description: Table whose styles are being listed

maxResults.description: Maximum number of styles to return. Optional. Default is 5.

update.description: Updates an existing style.

tableId.description: Table whose style is being updated.

styleId.description: Identifier (within a table) for the style being updated.

patch.description: Updates an existing style. This method supports patch semantics.

tableId.description: Table whose style is being updated.

styleId.description: Identifier (within a table) for the style being updated.

tableId.description: Table from which the style is being deleted

styleId.description: Identifier (within a table) for the style being deleted

insert.description: Creates a new template for the table.

tableId.description: Table for which a new template is being created

get.description: Retrieves a specific template by its id

tableId.description: Table to which the template belongs

templateId.description: Identifier for the template that is being requested

list.description: Retrieves a list of templates.

pageToken.description: Continuation token specifying which results page to return. Optional.

tableId.description: Identifier for the table whose templates are being requested

maxResults.description: Maximum number of templates to return. Optional. Default is 5.

update.description: Updates an existing template

tableId.description: Table to which the updated template belongs

templateId.description: Identifier for the template that is being updated

patch.description: Updates an existing template. This method supports patch semantics.

tableId.description: Table to which the updated template belongs

templateId.description: Identifier for the template that is being updated

tableId.description: Table from which the template is being deleted

templateId.description: Identifier for the template which is being deleted

insert.description: Creates a new table.

get.description: Retrieves a specific table by its id.

tableId.description: Identifier(ID) for the table being requested.

importRows.description: Import more rows into a table.

startLine.description: The index of the first line from which to start importing, inclusive. Default is 0.

encoding.description: The encoding of the content. Default is UTF-8. Use 'auto-detect' if you are unsure of the encoding.

isStrict.description: Whether the CSV must have the same number of values for each row. If false, rows with fewer values will be padded with empty values. Default is true.

delimiter.description: The delimiter used to separate cell values. This can only consist of a single character. Default is ','.

tableId.description: The table into which new rows are being imported.

endLine.description: The index of the last line from which to start importing, exclusive. Thus, the number of imported lines is endLine - startLine. If this parameter is not provided, the file will be imported until the last line of the file. If endLine is negative, then the imported content will exclude the last endLine lines. That is, if endline is negative, no line will be imported whose index is greater than N + endLine where N is the number of lines in the file, and the number of imported lines will be N + endLine - startLine.

list.description: Retrieves a list of tables a user owns.

pageToken.description: Continuation token specifying which result page to return. Optional.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of styles to return. Optional. Default is 5.

update.description: Updates an existing table. Unless explicitly requested, only the name, description, and attribution will be updated.

replaceViewDefinition.description: Should the view definition also be updated? The specified view definition replaces the existing one. Only a view can be updated with a new definition.

tableId.description: ID of the table that is being updated.

patch.description: Updates an existing table. Unless explicitly requested, only the name, description, and attribution will be updated. This method supports patch semantics.

replaceViewDefinition.description: Should the view definition also be updated? The specified view definition replaces the existing one. Only a view can be updated with a new definition.

tableId.description: ID of the table that is being updated.

delimiter.description: The delimiter used to separate cell values. This can only consist of a single character. Default is ','.

name.description: The name to be assigned to the new table.

encoding.description: The encoding of the content. Default is UTF-8. Use 'auto-detect' if you are unsure of the encoding.

copyPresentation.description: Whether to also copy tabs, styles, and templates. Default is false.

tableId.description: ID of the table that is being copied.
ID of the table that is being deleted.

description: API for working with Fusion Tables data.
name: fusiontables

GamesAchievementIncrement.description: This is a JSON template for the payload to request to increment an achievement.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#GamesAchievementIncrement.

steps.description: The number of steps to be incremented.

requestId.description: The requestId associated with an increment to an achievement.

PlayerScore.description: This is a JSON template for a player score.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#playerScore.

score.description: The numerical value for this player score.

formattedScore.description: The formatted score for this player score.

scoreTag.description: Additional information about this score. Values will contain no more than 64 URI-safe characters as defined by section 2.3 of RFC 3986.

timeSpan.description:
The time span for this player score.
Possible values are:  
- "ALL_TIME" - The score is an all-time score. 
- "WEEKLY" - The score is a weekly score. 
- "DAILY" - The score is a daily score.

AchievementDefinition.description: This is a JSON template for an achievement definition object.

totalSteps.description: The total steps for an incremental achievement.

achievementType.description:
The type of the achievement.
Possible values are:  
- "STANDARD" - Achievement is either locked or unlocked. 
- "INCREMENTAL" - Achievement is incremental.

description.description: The description of the achievement.

formattedTotalSteps.description: The total steps for an incremental achievement as a string.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#achievementDefinition.

initialState.description:
The initial state of the achievement.
Possible values are:  
- "HIDDEN" - Achievement is hidden. 
- "REVEALED" - Achievement is revealed. 
- "UNLOCKED" - Achievement is unlocked.

experiencePoints.description: Experience points which will be earned when unlocking this achievement.

id.description: The ID of the achievement.

isRevealedIconUrlDefault.description: Indicates whether the revealed icon image being returned is a default image, or is provided by the game.

unlockedIconUrl.description: The image URL for the unlocked achievement icon.

revealedIconUrl.description: The image URL for the revealed achievement icon.

isUnlockedIconUrlDefault.description: Indicates whether the unlocked icon image being returned is a default image, or is game-provided.

RoomAutoMatchingCriteria.description: This is a JSON template for a room auto-match criteria object.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomAutoMatchingCriteria.

minAutoMatchingPlayers.description: The minimum number of players that should be added to the room by auto-matching.

exclusiveBitmask.description: A bitmask indicating when auto-matches are valid. When ANDed with other exclusive bitmasks, the result must be zero. Can be used to support exclusive roles within a game.

maxAutoMatchingPlayers.description: The maximum number of players that should be added to the room by auto-matching.

InstanceIosDetails.description: This is a JSON template for the iOS details resource.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#instanceIosDetails.

supportIphone.description: Flag to indicate if this instance supports iPhone.

preferredForIpad.description: Indicates that this instance is the default for new installations on iPad devices.

supportIpad.description: Flag to indicate if this instance supports iPad.

preferredForIphone.description: Indicates that this instance is the default for new installations on iPhone devices.

TurnBasedMatchList.description: This is a JSON template for a list of turn-based matches.

nextPageToken.description: The pagination token for the next page of results.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedMatchList.

EventChild.description: This is a JSON template for an event child relationship resource.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#eventChild.

childId.description: The ID of the child event.

AchievementUpdateResponse.description: This is a JSON template for an achievement update response.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#achievementUpdateResponse.

achievementId.description: The achievement this update is was applied to.

currentSteps.description: The current steps recorded for this achievement if it is incremental.

newlyUnlocked.description: Whether this achievement was newly unlocked (that is, whether the unlock request for the achievement was the first for the player).

updateOccurred.description: Whether the requested updates actually affected the achievement.

currentState.description:
The current state of the achievement.
Possible values are:  
- "HIDDEN" - Achievement is hidden. 
- "REVEALED" - Achievement is revealed. 
- "UNLOCKED" - Achievement is unlocked.

RoomModification.description: This is a JSON template for room modification metadata.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomModification.

modifiedTimestampMillis.description: The timestamp at which they modified the room, in milliseconds since the epoch in UTC.

participantId.description: The ID of the participant that modified the room.

ImageAsset.description: This is a JSON template for an image asset object.

url.description: The URL of the asset.

width.description: The width of the asset.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#imageAsset.

height.description: The height of the asset.

TurnBasedMatchCreateRequest.description: This is a JSON template for a turn-based match creation request.

invitedPlayerIds.description: The player ids to invite to the match.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedMatchCreateRequest.

autoMatchingCriteria.description: Criteria for auto-matching players into this match.

variant.description: The variant / mode of the application to be played. This can be any integer value, or left blank. You should use a small number of variants to keep the auto-matching pool as large as possible.

requestId.description: A randomly generated numeric ID. This number is used at the server to ensure that the request is handled correctly across retries.

Quest.description: This is a JSON template for a Quest resource.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#quest.

description.description: The description of the quest.

iconUrl.description: The icon image URL for the quest.

bannerUrl.description: The banner image URL for the quest.

notifyTimestampMillis.description: The timestamp at which the user should be notified that the quest will end soon in milliseconds since the epoch in UTC.

lastUpdatedTimestampMillis.description: The timestamp at which the quest was last updated by the user in milliseconds since the epoch in UTC. Only present if the player has accepted the quest.

acceptedTimestampMillis.description: The timestamp at which the user accepted the quest in milliseconds since the epoch in UTC. Only present if the player has accepted the quest.

endTimestampMillis.description: The timestamp at which the quest ceases to be active in milliseconds since the epoch in UTC.

startTimestampMillis.description: The timestamp at which the quest becomes active in milliseconds since the epoch in UTC.

state.description:
The state of the quest.
Possible values are:  
- "UPCOMING": The quest is upcoming. The user can see the quest, but cannot accept it until it is open. 
- "OPEN": The quest is currently open and may be accepted at this time. 
- "ACCEPTED": The user is currently participating in this quest. 
- "COMPLETED": The user has completed the quest. 
- "FAILED": The quest was attempted but was not completed before the deadline expired. 
- "EXPIRED": The quest has expired and was not accepted. 
- "DELETED": The quest should be deleted from the local database.

isDefaultBannerUrl.description: Indicates whether the banner image being returned is a default image, or is game-provided.

isDefaultIconUrl.description: Indicates whether the icon image being returned is a default image, or is game-provided.

applicationId.description: The ID of the application this quest is part of.

id.description: The ID of the quest.

ParticipantResult.description: This is a JSON template for a result for a match participant.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#participantResult.

placing.description: The placement or ranking of the participant in the match results; a number from one to the number of participants in the match. Multiple participants may have the same placing value in case of a type.

result.description:
The result of the participant for this match.
Possible values are:  
- "MATCH_RESULT_WIN" - The participant won the match. 
- "MATCH_RESULT_LOSS" - The participant lost the match. 
- "MATCH_RESULT_TIE" - The participant tied the match. 
- "MATCH_RESULT_NONE" - There was no winner for the match (nobody wins or loses this kind of game.) 
- "MATCH_RESULT_DISCONNECT" - The participant disconnected / left during the match. 
- "MATCH_RESULT_DISAGREED" - Different clients reported different results for this participant.

NetworkDiagnostics.description: This is a JSON template for network diagnostics reported for a client.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#networkDiagnostics.

iosNetworkType.description: iOS network type as defined in Reachability.h.

networkOperatorCode.description: The MCC+MNC code for the client's network connection. On Android: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/telephony/TelephonyManager.html#getNetworkOperator() On iOS, see: https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/NetworkingInternet/Reference/CTCarrier/Reference/Reference.html

networkOperatorName.description: The name of the carrier of the client's network connection. On Android: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/telephony/TelephonyManager.html#getNetworkOperatorName() On iOS: https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/NetworkingInternet/Reference/CTCarrier/Reference/Reference.html#//apple_ref/occ/instp/CTCarrier/carrierName

registrationLatencyMillis.description: The amount of time in milliseconds it took for the client to establish a connection with the XMPP server.

EventBatchRecordFailure.description: This is a JSON template for a batch update failure resource.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#eventBatchRecordFailure.

range.description: The time range which was rejected; empty for a request-wide failure.

failureCause.description:
The cause for the update failure.
Possible values are:  
- "TOO_LARGE": A batch request was issued with more events than are allowed in a single batch. 
- "TIME_PERIOD_EXPIRED": A batch was sent with data too far in the past to record. 
- "TIME_PERIOD_SHORT": A batch was sent with a time range that was too short. 
- "TIME_PERIOD_LONG": A batch was sent with a time range that was too long. 
- "ALREADY_UPDATED": An attempt was made to record a batch of data which was already seen. 
- "RECORD_RATE_HIGH": An attempt was made to record data faster than the server will apply updates.

SnapshotListResponse.description: This is a JSON template for a list of snapshot objects.

nextPageToken.description: Token corresponding to the next page of results. If there are no more results, the token is omitted.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#snapshotListResponse.

PlayerExperienceInfo.description: This is a JSON template for 1P/3P metadata about the player's experience.

currentExperiencePoints.description: The current number of experience points for the player.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#playerExperienceInfo.

lastLevelUpTimestampMillis.description: The timestamp when the player was leveled up, in millis since Unix epoch UTC.

nextLevel.description: The next level of the player. If the current level is the maximum level, this should be same as the current level.

currentLevel.description: The current level of the player.

PlayerScoreListResponse.description: This is a JSON template for a list of score submission statuses.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#playerScoreListResponse.

RoomLeaveDiagnostics.description: This is a JSON template for room leave diagnostics.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomLeaveDiagnostics.

socketsUsed.description: Whether or not sockets were used.

iosNetworkType.description: iOS network type as defined in Reachability.h.

networkOperatorCode.description: The MCC+MNC code for the client's network connection. On Android: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/telephony/TelephonyManager.html#getNetworkOperator() On iOS, see: https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/NetworkingInternet/Reference/CTCarrier/Reference/Reference.html

networkOperatorName.description: The name of the carrier of the client's network connection. On Android: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/telephony/TelephonyManager.html#getNetworkOperatorName() On iOS: https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/NetworkingInternet/Reference/CTCarrier/Reference/Reference.html#//apple_ref/occ/instp/CTCarrier/carrierName

QuestMilestone.description: This is a JSON template for a Quest Milestone resource.

id.description: The milestone ID.

state.description:
The current state of the milestone.
Possible values are:  
- "COMPLETED_NOT_CLAIMED" - The milestone is complete, but has not yet been claimed. 
- "CLAIMED" - The milestone is complete and has been claimed. 
- "NOT_COMPLETED" - The milestone has not yet been completed. 
- "NOT_STARTED" - The milestone is for a quest that has not yet been accepted.

completionRewardData.description: The completion reward data of the milestone, represented as a Base64-encoded string. This is a developer-specified binary blob with size between 0 and 2 KB before encoding.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#questMilestone.

PlayerLeaderboardScoreListResponse.description: This is a JSON template for a list of player leaderboard scores.

nextPageToken.description: The pagination token for the next page of results.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#playerLeaderboardScoreListResponse.

player.description: The Player resources for the owner of this score.

PlayerAchievement.description: This is a JSON template for an achievement object.

achievementState.description:
The state of the achievement.
Possible values are:  
- "HIDDEN" - Achievement is hidden. 
- "REVEALED" - Achievement is revealed. 
- "UNLOCKED" - Achievement is unlocked.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#playerAchievement.

lastUpdatedTimestamp.description: The timestamp of the last modification to this achievement's state.

currentSteps.description: The current steps for an incremental achievement.

experiencePoints.description: Experience points earned for the achievement. This field is absent for achievements that have not yet been unlocked and 0 for achievements that have been unlocked by testers but that are unpublished.

formattedCurrentStepsString.description: The current steps for an incremental achievement as a string.

id.description: The ID of the achievement.

QuestContribution.description: This is a JSON template for a Quest Criterion Contribution resource.

formattedValue.description: The formatted value of the contribution as a string. Format depends on the configuration for the associated event definition in the Play Games Developer Console.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#questContribution.

value.description: The value of the contribution.

PeerSessionDiagnostics.description: This is a JSON template for peer session diagnostics.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#peerSessionDiagnostics.

participantId.description: The participant ID of the peer.

EventDefinition.description: This is a JSON template for an event definition resource.

isDefaultImageUrl.description: Indicates whether the icon image being returned is a default image, or is game-provided.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#eventDefinition.

displayName.description: The name to display for the event.

description.description: Description of what this event represents.

imageUrl.description: The base URL for the image that represents the event.

visibility.description:
The visibility of event being tracked in this definition.
Possible values are:  
- "REVEALED": This event should be visible to all users. 
- "HIDDEN": This event should only be shown to users that have recorded this event at least once.

childEvents.description: A list of events that are a child of this event.

id.description: The ID of the event.

Application.description: This is a JSON template for the Application resource.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#application.

description.description: The description of the application.

lastUpdatedTimestamp.description: The last updated timestamp of the application.

enabledFeatures.description:
A list of features that have been enabled for the application.
Possible values are:  
- "SNAPSHOTS" - Snapshots has been enabled

achievement_count.description: The number of achievements visible to the currently authenticated player.

leaderboard_count.description: The number of leaderboards visible to the currently authenticated player.

id.description: The ID of the application.

InstanceAndroidDetails.description: This is a JSON template for the Android instance details resource.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#instanceAndroidDetails.

enablePiracyCheck.description: Flag indicating whether the anti-piracy check is enabled.

packageName.description: Android package name which maps to Google Play URL.

preferred.description: Indicates that this instance is the default for new installations.

LeaderboardEntry.description: This is a JSON template for the Leaderboard Entry resource.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#leaderboardEntry.

scoreValue.description: The numerical value of this score.

scoreTag.description: Additional information about the score. Values must contain no more than 64 URI-safe characters as defined by section 2.3 of RFC 3986.

timeSpan.description:
The time span of this high score.
Possible values are:  
- "ALL_TIME" - The score is an all-time high score. 
- "WEEKLY" - The score is a weekly high score. 
- "DAILY" - The score is a daily high score.

formattedScore.description: The localized string for the numerical value of this score.

player.description: The player who holds this score.

formattedScoreRank.description: The localized string for the rank of this score for this leaderboard.

scoreRank.description: The rank of this score for this leaderboard.

writeTimestampMillis.description: The timestamp at which this score was recorded, in milliseconds since the epoch in UTC.

RoomCreateRequest.description: This is a JSON template for a room creation request.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomCreateRequest.

autoMatchingCriteria.description: Criteria for auto-matching players into this room.

invitedPlayerIds.description: The player IDs to invite to the room.

variant.description: The variant / mode of the application to be played. This can be any integer value, or left blank. You should use a small number of variants to keep the auto-matching pool as large as possible.

capabilities.description: The capabilities that this client supports for realtime communication.

networkDiagnostics.description: Network diagnostics for the client creating the room.

clientAddress.description: Client address for the player creating the room.

requestId.description: A randomly generated numeric ID. This number is used at the server to ensure that the request is handled correctly across retries.

QuestListResponse.description: This is a JSON template for a list of quest objects.

nextPageToken.description: Token corresponding to the next page of results.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#questListResponse.

PlayerListResponse.description: This is a JSON template for a third party player list response.

nextPageToken.description: Token corresponding to the next page of results.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#playerListResponse.

TurnBasedMatchModification.description: This is a JSON template for turn-based match modification metadata.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedMatchModification.

modifiedTimestampMillis.description: The timestamp at which they modified the match, in milliseconds since the epoch in UTC.

participantId.description: The ID of the participant that modified the match.

PlayerScoreSubmissionList.description: This is a JSON template for a list of score submission requests

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#playerScoreSubmissionList.

SnapshotImage.description: This is a JSON template for an image of a snapshot.

url.description: The URL of the image. This URL may be invalidated at any time and should not be cached.

width.description: The width of the image.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#snapshotImage.

mime_type.description: The MIME type of the image.

height.description: The height of the image.

AnonymousPlayer.description: This is a JSON template for an anonymous player

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#anonymousPlayer.

avatarImageUrl.description: The base URL for the image to display for the anonymous player.

displayName.description: The name to display for the anonymous player.

RoomStatus.description: This is a JSON template for the status of a room that the player has joined.

status.description:
The status of the room.
Possible values are:  
- "ROOM_INVITING" - One or more players have been invited and not responded. 
- "ROOM_AUTO_MATCHING" - One or more slots need to be filled by auto-matching. 
- "ROOM_CONNECTING" - Players have joined are connecting to each other (either before or after auto-matching). 
- "ROOM_ACTIVE" - All players have joined and connected to each other. 
- "ROOM_DELETED" - All joined players have left.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomStatus.

autoMatchingStatus.description: Auto-matching status for this room. Not set if the room is not currently in the automatching queue.

participants.description: The participants involved in the room, along with their statuses. Includes participants who have left or declined invitations.

statusVersion.description: The version of the status for the room: an increasing counter, used by the client to ignore out-of-order updates to room status.

roomId.description: Globally unique ID for a room.

TurnBasedMatchParticipant.description: This is a JSON template for a participant in a turn-based match.

autoMatched.description: True if this participant was auto-matched with the requesting player.

status.description:
The status of the participant with respect to the match.
Possible values are:  
- "PARTICIPANT_NOT_INVITED_YET" - The participant is slated to be invited to the match, but the invitation has not been sent; the invite will be sent when it becomes their turn. 
- "PARTICIPANT_INVITED" - The participant has been invited to join the match, but has not yet responded. 
- "PARTICIPANT_JOINED" - The participant has joined the match (either after creating it or accepting an invitation.) 
- "PARTICIPANT_DECLINED" - The participant declined an invitation to join the match. 
- "PARTICIPANT_LEFT" - The participant joined the match and then left it. 
- "PARTICIPANT_FINISHED" - The participant finished playing in the match. 
- "PARTICIPANT_UNRESPONSIVE" - The participant did not take their turn in the allotted time.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedMatchParticipant.

autoMatchedPlayer.description: Information about a player that has been anonymously auto-matched against the requesting player. (Either player or autoMatchedPlayer will be set.)

player.description: Information about the player. Not populated if this player was anonymously auto-matched against the requesting player. (Either player or autoMatchedPlayer will be set.)

id.description: An identifier for the participant in the scope of the match. Cannot be used to identify a player across matches or in other contexts.

LeaderboardScoreRank.description: This is a JSON template for a score rank in a leaderboard.

numScores.description: The number of scores in the leaderboard.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#leaderboardScoreRank.

formattedRank.description: The rank in the leaderboard as a string.

formattedNumScores.description: The number of scores in the leaderboard as a string.

PeerChannelDiagnostics.description: This is a JSON template for peer channel diagnostics.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#peerChannelDiagnostics.

RoomP2PStatus.description: This is a JSON template for an update on the status of a peer in a room.

status.description:
The status of the peer in the room.
Possible values are:  
- "CONNECTION_ESTABLISHED" - The client established a P2P connection with the peer. 
- "CONNECTION_FAILED" - The client failed to establish directed presence with the peer.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomP2PStatus.

unreliableRoundtripLatencyMillis.description: The amount of time in milliseconds it took to send packets back and forth on the unreliable channel with this peer.

connectionSetupLatencyMillis.description: The amount of time in milliseconds it took to establish connections with this peer.

error.description:
The error code in event of a failure.
Possible values are:  
- "P2P_FAILED" - The client failed to establish a P2P connection with the peer. 
- "PRESENCE_FAILED" - The client failed to register to receive P2P connections. 
- "RELAY_SERVER_FAILED" - The client received an error when trying to use the relay server to establish a P2P connection with the peer.

error_reason.description: More detailed diagnostic message returned in event of a failure.

EventPeriodUpdate.description: This is a JSON template for an event period update resource.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#eventPeriodUpdate.

timePeriod.description: The time period being covered by this update.

updates.description: The updates being made for this time period.

ApplicationCategory.description: This is a JSON template for an application category object.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#applicationCategory.

ScoreSubmission.description: This is a JSON template for a request to submit a score to leaderboards.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#scoreSubmission.

leaderboardId.description: The leaderboard this score is being submitted to.

scoreTag.description: Additional information about this score. Values will contain no more than 64 URI-safe characters as defined by section 2.3 of RFC 3986.

TurnBasedMatchTurn.description: This is a JSON template for the object representing a turn.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedMatchTurn.

pendingParticipantId.description: The ID of the participant who should take their turn next. May be set to the current player's participant ID to update match state without changing the turn. If not set, the match will wait for other player(s) to join via automatching; this is only valid if automatch criteria is set on the match with remaining slots for automatched players.

data.description: The shared game state data after the turn is over.

results.description: The match results for the participants in the match.

matchVersion.description: The version of this match: an increasing counter, used to avoid out-of-date updates to the match.

EventRecordRequest.description: This is a JSON template for an event period update resource.

timePeriods.description: A list of the time period updates being made in this request.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#eventRecordRequest.

requestId.description: The request ID used to identify this attempt to record events.

currentTimeMillis.description: The current time when this update was sent, in milliseconds, since 1970 UTC (Unix Epoch).

CategoryListResponse.description: This is a JSON template for a list of category data objects.

nextPageToken.description: Token corresponding to the next page of results.

items.description: The list of categories with usage data.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#categoryListResponse.

EventUpdateResponse.description: This is a JSON template for an event period update resource.

playerEvents.description: The current status of any updated events

batchFailures.description: Any batch-wide failures which occurred applying updates.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#eventUpdateResponse.

eventFailures.description: Any failures updating a particular event.

PlayerScoreResponse.description: This is a JSON template for a list of leaderboard entry resources.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#playerScoreResponse.

scoreTag.description: Additional information about this score. Values will contain no more than 64 URI-safe characters as defined by section 2.3 of RFC 3986.

leaderboardId.description: The leaderboard ID that this score was submitted to.

formattedScore.description: The formatted value of the submitted score.

beatenScoreTimeSpans.description:
The time spans where the submitted score is better than the existing score for that time span.
Possible values are:  
- "ALL_TIME" - The score is an all-time score. 
- "WEEKLY" - The score is a weekly score. 
- "DAILY" - The score is a daily score.

unbeatenScores.description: The scores in time spans that have not been beaten. As an example, the submitted score may be better than the player's DAILY score, but not better than the player's scores for the WEEKLY or ALL_TIME time spans.

LeaderboardListResponse.description: This is a JSON template for a list of leaderboard objects.

nextPageToken.description: Token corresponding to the next page of results.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#leaderboardListResponse.

Category.description: This is a JSON template for data related to individual game categories.

experiencePoints.description: Experience points earned in this category.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#category.

Instance.description: This is a JSON template for the Instance resource.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#instance.

acquisitionUri.description: URI which shows where a user can acquire this instance.

turnBasedPlay.description: Flag to show if this game instance supports turn based play.

platformType.description:
The platform type.
Possible values are:  
- "ANDROID" - Instance is for Android. 
- "IOS" - Instance is for iOS 
- "WEB_APP" - Instance is for Web App.

realtimePlay.description: Flag to show if this game instance supports realtime play.

AchievementUnlockResponse.description: This is a JSON template for an achievement unlock response

newlyUnlocked.description: Whether this achievement was newly unlocked (that is, whether the unlock request for the achievement was the first for the player).

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#achievementUnlockResponse.

EventUpdateRequest.description: This is a JSON template for an event period update resource.

definitionId.description: The ID of the event being modified in this update.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#eventUpdateRequest.

updateCount.description: The number of times this event occurred in this time period.
