kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#achievementUpdateListResponse.

updatedAchievements.description: The updated state of the achievements.

EventRecordFailure.description: This is a JSON template for an event update failure resource.

eventId.description: The ID of the event that was not updated.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#eventRecordFailure.

failureCause.description:
The cause for the update failure.
Possible values are:  
- "NOT_FOUND" - An attempt was made to set an event that was not defined. 
- "INVALID_UPDATE_VALUE" - An attempt was made to increment an event by a non-positive value.

RevisionCheckResponse.description: This is a JSON template for the result of checking a revision.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#revisionCheckResponse.

revisionStatus.description:
The result of the revision check.
Possible values are:  
- "OK" - The revision being used is current. 
- "DEPRECATED" - There is currently a newer version available, but the revision being used still works. 
- "INVALID" - The revision being used is not supported in any released version.

apiVersion.description: The version of the API this client revision should use when calling API methods.

RoomP2PStatuses.description: This is a JSON template for an update on the status of peers in a room.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomP2PStatuses.

AchievementIncrementResponse.description: This is a JSON template for an achievement increment response

currentSteps.description: The current steps recorded for this incremental achievement.

newlyUnlocked.description: Whether the the current steps for the achievement has reached the number of steps required to unlock.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#achievementIncrementResponse.

TurnBasedMatchSync.description: This is a JSON template for a list of turn-based matches returned from a sync.

nextPageToken.description: The pagination token for the next page of results.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedMatchSync.

moreAvailable.description: True if there were more matches available to fetch at the time the response was generated (which were not returned due to page size limits.)

AggregateStats.description: This is a JSON template for aggregate stats.

count.description: The number of messages sent between a pair of peers.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#aggregateStats.

sum.description: The total number of bytes sent for messages between a pair of peers.

AchievementSetStepsAtLeastResponse.description: This is a JSON template for an achievement set steps at least response.

currentSteps.description: The current steps recorded for this incremental achievement.

newlyUnlocked.description: Whether the the current steps for the achievement has reached the number of steps required to unlock.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#achievementSetStepsAtLeastResponse.

MetagameConfig.description: This is a JSON template for the metagame config resource

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#metagameConfig.

currentVersion.description: Current version of the metagame configuration data. When this data is updated, the version number will be increased by one.

AchievementDefinitionsListResponse.description: This is a JSON template for a list of achievement definition objects.

nextPageToken.description: Token corresponding to the next page of results.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#achievementDefinitionsListResponse.

RoomAutoMatchStatus.description: This is a JSON template for status of room automatching that is in progress.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomAutoMatchStatus.

waitEstimateSeconds.description: An estimate for the amount of time (in seconds) that auto-matching is expected to take to complete.

EventPeriodRange.description: This is a JSON template for an event period time range.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#eventPeriodRange.

periodStartMillis.description: The time when this update period begins, in millis, since 1970 UTC (Unix Epoch).

periodEndMillis.description: The time when this update period ends, in millis, since 1970 UTC (Unix Epoch).

PlayerAchievementListResponse.description: This is a JSON template for a list of achievement objects.

nextPageToken.description: Token corresponding to the next page of results.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#playerAchievementListResponse.

LeaderboardScores.description: This is a JSON template for a ListScores response.

nextPageToken.description: The pagination token for the next page of results.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#leaderboardScores.

numScores.description: The total number of scores in the leaderboard.

playerScore.description: The score of the requesting player on the leaderboard. The player's score may appear both here and in the list of scores above. If you are viewing a public leaderboard and the player is not sharing their gameplay information publicly, the scoreRank and formattedScoreRank values will not be present.

prevPageToken.description: The pagination token for the previous page of results.

RoomParticipant.description: This is a JSON template for a participant in a room.

autoMatched.description: True if this participant was auto-matched with the requesting player.

status.description:
The status of the participant with respect to the room.
Possible values are:  
- "PARTICIPANT_INVITED" - The participant has been invited to join the room, but has not yet responded. 
- "PARTICIPANT_JOINED" - The participant has joined the room (either after creating it or accepting an invitation.) 
- "PARTICIPANT_DECLINED" - The participant declined an invitation to join the room. 
- "PARTICIPANT_LEFT" - The participant joined the room and then left it.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomParticipant.

autoMatchedPlayer.description: Information about a player that has been anonymously auto-matched against the requesting player. (Either player or autoMatchedPlayer will be set.)

capabilities.description: The capabilities which can be used when communicating with this participant.

player.description: Information about the player. Not populated if this player was anonymously auto-matched against the requesting player. (Either player or autoMatchedPlayer will be set.)

leaveReason.description:
The reason the participant left the room; populated if the participant status is PARTICIPANT_LEFT.
Possible values are:  
- "PLAYER_LEFT" - The player explicitly chose to leave the room. 
- "GAME_LEFT" - The game chose to remove the player from the room. 
- "ABANDONED" - The player switched to another application and abandoned the room.
- "PEER_CONNECTION_FAILURE" - The client was unable to establish or maintain a connection to other peer(s) in the room.
- "SERVER_ERROR" - The client received an error response when it tried to communicate with the server. 
- "TIMEOUT" - The client timed out while waiting for players to join and connect. 
- "PRESENCE_FAILURE" - The client's XMPP connection ended abruptly.

connected.description: True if this participant is in the fully connected set of peers in the room.

id.description: An identifier for the participant in the scope of the room. Cannot be used to identify a player across rooms or in other contexts.

Snapshot.description: This is a JSON template for an snapshot object.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#snapshot.

description.description: The description of this snapshot.

coverImage.description: The cover image of this snapshot. May be absent if there is no image.

lastModifiedMillis.description: The timestamp (in millis since Unix epoch) of the last modification to this snapshot.

driveId.description: The ID of the file underlying this snapshot in the Drive API. Only present if the snapshot is a view on a Drive file and the file is owned by the caller.

durationMillis.description: The duration associated with this snapshot, in millis.

uniqueName.description: The unique name provided when the snapshot was created.

type.description:
The type of this snapshot.
Possible values are:  
- "SAVE_GAME" - A snapshot representing a save game.

id.description: The ID of the snapshot.

RoomLeaveRequest.description: This is a JSON template for a leave room request.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomLeaveRequest.

reason.description:
Reason for leaving the match.
Possible values are:  
- "PLAYER_LEFT" - The player chose to leave the room.. 
- "GAME_LEFT" - The game chose to remove the player from the room. 
- "REALTIME_ABANDONED" - The player switched to another application and abandoned the room. 
- "REALTIME_PEER_CONNECTION_FAILURE" - The client was unable to establish a connection to other peer(s). 
- "REALTIME_SERVER_CONNECTION_FAILURE" - The client was unable to communicate with the server. 
- "REALTIME_SERVER_ERROR" - The client received an error response when it tried to communicate with the server. 
- "REALTIME_TIMEOUT" - The client timed out while waiting for a room. 
- "REALTIME_CLIENT_DISCONNECTING" - The client disconnects without first calling Leave. 
- "REALTIME_SIGN_OUT" - The user signed out of G+ while in the room. 
- "REALTIME_GAME_CRASHED" - The game crashed. 
- "REALTIME_ROOM_SERVICE_CRASHED" - RoomAndroidService crashed. 
- "REALTIME_DIFFERENT_CLIENT_ROOM_OPERATION" - Another client is trying to enter a room. 
- "REALTIME_SAME_CLIENT_ROOM_OPERATION" - The same client is trying to enter a new room.

leaveDiagnostics.description: Diagnostics for a player leaving the room.

PushToken.description: This is a JSON template for a push token resource.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#pushToken.

clientRevision.description:
The revision of the client SDK used by your application, in the same format that's used by revisions.check. Used to send backward compatible messages. Format: [PLATFORM_TYPE]:[VERSION_NUMBER]. Possible values of PLATFORM_TYPE are:  
- IOS - Push token is for iOS

id.description: Unique identifier for this push token.

language.description: The preferred language for notifications that are sent using this token.

TurnBasedMatchRematch.description: This is a JSON template for a rematch response.

rematch.description: The newly created match; a rematch of the old match with the same participants.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedMatchRematch.

previousMatch.description: The old match that the rematch was created from; will be updated such that the rematchId field will point at the new match.

QuestCriterion.description: This is a JSON template for a Quest Criterion resource.

eventId.description: The ID of the event the criterion corresponds to.

completionContribution.description: The total number of times the associated event must be incremented for the player to complete this quest.

initialPlayerProgress.description:
The value of the event associated with this quest at the time that the quest was accepted. This value may change if event increments that took place before the start of quest are uploaded after the quest starts.
There will be no initialPlayerProgress until the player has accepted the quest.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#questCriterion.

currentContribution.description:
The number of increments the player has made toward the completion count event increments required to complete the quest. This value will not exceed the completion contribution.
There will be no currentContribution until the player has accepted the quest.

RoomList.description: This is a JSON template for a list of rooms.

nextPageToken.description: The pagination token for the next page of results.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomList.

PlayerLevel.description: This is a JSON template for 1P/3P metadata about a user's level.

maxExperiencePoints.description: The maximum experience points for this level.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#playerLevel.

minExperiencePoints.description: The minimum experience points for this level.

TurnBasedMatchData.description: This is a JSON template for a turn-based match data object.

data.description: The byte representation of the data (limited to 128 kB), as a Base64-encoded string with the URL_SAFE encoding option.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedMatchData.

dataAvailable.description: True if this match has data available but it wasn't returned in a list response; fetching the match individually will retrieve this data.

AchievementRevealResponse.description: This is a JSON template for an achievement reveal response

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#achievementRevealResponse.

currentState.description:
The current state of the achievement for which a reveal was attempted. This might be UNLOCKED if the achievement was already unlocked.
Possible values are:  
- "REVEALED" - Achievement is revealed. 
- "UNLOCKED" - Achievement is unlocked.

TurnBasedAutoMatchingCriteria.description: This is a JSON template for an turn-based auto-match criteria object.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedAutoMatchingCriteria.

minAutoMatchingPlayers.description: The minimum number of players that should be added to the match by auto-matching.

exclusiveBitmask.description: A bitmask indicating when auto-matches are valid. When ANDed with other exclusive bitmasks, the result must be zero. Can be used to support exclusive roles within a game.

maxAutoMatchingPlayers.description: The maximum number of players that should be added to the match by auto-matching.

PlayerEventListResponse.description: This is a JSON template for a ListByPlayer response.

nextPageToken.description: The pagination token for the next page of results.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#playerEventListResponse.

TurnBasedMatchResults.description: This is a JSON template for a turn-based match results object.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedMatchResults.

data.description: The final match data.

matchVersion.description: The version of the match being updated.

results.description: The match results for the participants in the match.

EventDefinitionListResponse.description: This is a JSON template for a ListDefinitions response.

nextPageToken.description: The pagination token for the next page of results.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#eventDefinitionListResponse.

PlayerLeaderboardScore.description: This is a JSON template for a player leaderboard score object.

writeTimestamp.description: The timestamp at which this score was recorded, in milliseconds since the epoch in UTC.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#playerLeaderboardScore.

publicRank.description: The public rank of the score in this leaderboard. This object will not be present if the user is not sharing their scores publicly.

scoreTag.description: Additional information about the score. Values must contain no more than 64 URI-safe characters as defined by section 2.3 of RFC 3986.

timeSpan.description:
The time span of this score.
Possible values are:  
- "ALL_TIME" - The score is an all-time score. 
- "WEEKLY" - The score is a weekly score. 
- "DAILY" - The score is a daily score.

scoreString.description: The formatted value of this score.

leaderboard_id.description: The ID of the leaderboard this score is in.

scoreValue.description: The numerical value of this score.

socialRank.description: The social rank of the score in this leaderboard.

TurnBasedMatchDataRequest.description: This is a JSON template for sending a turn-based match data object.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedMatchDataRequest.

data.description: The byte representation of the data (limited to 128 kB), as a Base64-encoded string with the URL_SAFE encoding option.

PushTokenId.description: This is a JSON template for a push token ID resource.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#pushTokenId.

ios.description: A push token ID for iOS devices.

apns_device_token.description: Device token supplied by an iOS system call to register for remote notifications. Encode this field as web-safe base64.

apns_environment.description: Indicates whether this token should be used for the production or sandbox APNS server.

RoomJoinRequest.description: This is a JSON template for a join room request.

networkDiagnostics.description: Network diagnostics for the client joining the room.

clientAddress.description: Client address for the player joining the room.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomJoinRequest.

capabilities.description: The capabilities that this client supports for realtime communication.

Leaderboard.description: This is a JSON template for the Leaderboard resource.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#leaderboard.

isIconUrlDefault.description: Indicates whether the icon image being returned is a default image, or is game-provided.

order.description:
How scores are ordered.
Possible values are:  
- "LARGER_IS_BETTER" - Larger values are better; scores are sorted in descending order. 
- "SMALLER_IS_BETTER" - Smaller values are better; scores are sorted in ascending order.

id.description: The leaderboard ID.

Room.description: This is a JSON template for a room resource object.

status.description:
The status of the room.
Possible values are:  
- "ROOM_INVITING" - One or more players have been invited and not responded. 
- "ROOM_AUTO_MATCHING" - One or more slots need to be filled by auto-matching. 
- "ROOM_CONNECTING" - Players have joined and are connecting to each other (either before or after auto-matching). 
- "ROOM_ACTIVE" - All players have joined and connected to each other. 
- "ROOM_DELETED" - The room should no longer be shown on the client. Returned in sync calls when a player joins a room (as a tombstone), or for rooms where all joined participants have left.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#room.

autoMatchingCriteria.description: Criteria for auto-matching players into this room.

description.description: This short description is generated by our servers and worded relative to the player requesting the room. It is intended to be displayed when the room is shown in a list (that is, an invitation to a room.)

roomStatusVersion.description: The version of the room status: an increasing counter, used by the client to ignore out-of-order updates to room status.

autoMatchingStatus.description: Auto-matching status for this room. Not set if the room is not currently in the auto-matching queue.

lastUpdateDetails.description: Details about the last update to the room.

variant.description: The variant / mode of the application being played; can be any integer value, or left blank.

participants.description: The participants involved in the room, along with their statuses. Includes participants who have left or declined invitations.

applicationId.description: The ID of the application being played.

roomId.description: Globally unique ID for a room.

inviterId.description: The ID of the participant that invited the user to the room. Not set if the user was not invited to the room.

AchievementUpdateMultipleRequest.description: This is a JSON template for a list of achievement update requests.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#achievementUpdateMultipleRequest.

RoomClientAddress.description: This is a JSON template for the client address when setting up a room.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomClientAddress.

xmppAddress.description: The XMPP address of the client on the Google Games XMPP network.

TurnBasedMatch.description: This is a JSON template for a turn-based match resource object.

status.description:
The status of the match.
Possible values are:  
- "MATCH_AUTO_MATCHING" - One or more slots need to be filled by auto-matching; the match cannot be established until they are filled. 
- "MATCH_ACTIVE" - The match has started. 
- "MATCH_COMPLETE" - The match has finished. 
- "MATCH_CANCELED" - The match was canceled. 
- "MATCH_EXPIRED" - The match expired due to inactivity. 
- "MATCH_DELETED" - The match should no longer be shown on the client. Returned only for tombstones for matches when sync is called.

withParticipantId.description: The ID of another participant in the match that can be used when describing the participants the user is playing with.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedMatch.

autoMatchingCriteria.description: Criteria for auto-matching players into this match.

inviterId.description: The ID of the participant that invited the user to the match. Not set if the user was not invited to the match.

rematchId.description: The ID of a rematch of this match. Only set for completed matches that have been rematched.

description.description: This short description is generated by our servers based on turn state and is localized and worded relative to the player requesting the match. It is intended to be displayed when the match is shown in a list.

matchId.description: Globally unique ID for a turn-based match.

variant.description: The variant / mode of the application being played; can be any integer value, or left blank.

lastUpdateDetails.description: Details about the last update to the match.

matchNumber.description: The number of the match in a chain of rematches. Will be set to 1 for the first match and incremented by 1 for each rematch.

participants.description: The participants involved in the match, along with their statuses. Includes participants who have left or declined invitations.

previousMatchData.description: The data / game state for the previous match; set for the first turn of rematches only.

applicationId.description: The ID of the application being played.

results.description: The results reported for this match.

pendingParticipantId.description: The ID of the participant that is taking a turn.

data.description: The data / game state for this match.

userMatchStatus.description:
The status of the current user in the match. Derived from the match type, match status, the user's participant status, and the pending participant for the match.
Possible values are:  
- "USER_INVITED" - The user has been invited to join the match and has not responded yet. 
- "USER_AWAITING_TURN" - The user is waiting for their turn. 
- "USER_TURN" - The user has an action to take in the match. 
- "USER_MATCH_COMPLETED" - The match has ended (it is completed, canceled, or expired.)

matchVersion.description: The version of this match: an increasing counter, used to avoid out-of-date updates to the match.

InstanceWebDetails.description: This is a JSON template for the Web details resource.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#instanceWebDetails.

preferred.description: Indicates that this instance is the default for new installations.

Played.description: This is a JSON template for metadata about a player playing a game with the currently authenticated user.

autoMatched.description: True if the player was auto-matched with the currently authenticated user.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#played.

timeMillis.description: The last time the player played the game in milliseconds since the epoch in UTC.

PlayerEvent.description: This is a JSON template for an event status resource.

definitionId.description: The ID of the event definition.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#playerEvent.

numEvents.description: The current number of times this event has occurred.

formattedNumEvents.description: The current number of times this event has occurred, as a string. The formatting of this string depends on the configuration of your event in the Play Games Developer Console.

Player.description: This is a JSON template for a Player resource.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#player.

displayName.description: The name to display for the player.

name.description: An object representation of the individual components of the player's name. For some players, these fields may not be present.

givenName.description: The given name of this player. In some places, this is known as the first name.

familyName.description: The family name of this player. In some places, this is known as the last name.

title.description: The player's title rewarded for their game activities.

lastPlayedWith.description: Details about the last time this player played a multiplayer game with the currently authenticated player. Populated for PLAYED_WITH player collection members.

experienceInfo.description: An object to represent Play Game experience information for the player.

avatarImageUrl.description: The base URL for the image that represents the player.

AchievementUpdateRequest.description: This is a JSON template for a request to update an achievement.

achievementId.description: The achievement this update is being applied to.

updateType.description:
The type of update being applied.
Possible values are:  
- "REVEAL" - Achievement is revealed. 
- "UNLOCK" - Achievement is unlocked. 
- "INCREMENT" - Achievement is incremented. 
- "SET_STEPS_AT_LEAST" - Achievement progress is set to at least the passed value.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#achievementUpdateRequest.

setStepsAtLeastPayload.description: The payload if an update of type SET_STEPS_AT_LEAST was requested for the achievement.

incrementPayload.description: The payload if an update of type INCREMENT was requested for the achievement.

GamesAchievementSetStepsAtLeast.description: This is a JSON template for the payload to request to increment an achievement.

kind.description: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#GamesAchievementSetStepsAtLeast.

steps.description: The minimum number of steps for the achievement to be set to.

title: Google Play Game Services Management API

reset.description: Resets the achievement with the given ID for the currently authenticated player. This method is only accessible to whitelisted tester accounts for your application.

achievementId.description: The ID of the achievement used by this method.

resetForAllPlayers.description: Resets the achievement with the given ID for the all players. This method is only available to user accounts for your developer console. Only draft achievements can be reset.

achievementId.description: The ID of the achievement used by this method.

resetAll.description: Resets all achievements for the currently authenticated player for your application. This method is only accessible to whitelisted tester accounts for your application.

listHidden.description: Get the list of players hidden from the given application. This method is only available to user accounts for your developer console.

pageToken.description: The token returned by the previous request.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of player resources to return in the response, used for paging. For any response, the actual number of player resources returned may be less than the specified maxResults.

reset.description: Reset scores for the specified leaderboard for the currently authenticated player. This method is only accessible to whitelisted tester accounts for your application.

resetForAllPlayers.description: Reset scores for the specified leaderboard for all players. This method is only available to user accounts for your developer console. Only draft leaderboards can be reset.

hide.description: Hide the given player's leaderboard scores from the given application. This method is only available to user accounts for your developer console.

playerId.description: A player ID. A value of me may be used in place of the authenticated player's ID.

unhide.description: Unhide the given player's leaderboard scores from the given application. This method is only available to user accounts for your developer console.

playerId.description: A player ID. A value of me may be used in place of the authenticated player's ID.

reset.description: Reset all rooms for the currently authenticated player for your application. This method is only accessible to whitelisted tester accounts for your application.
Reset all player progress on the quest for the currently authenticated player. This method is only accessible to whitelisted tester accounts for your application.

Reset all player progress on the event for the currently authenticated player. This method is only accessible to whitelisted tester accounts for your application. All resources that use the event will also be reset.

eventId.description: The ID of the event.

resetForAllPlayers.description: Reset all player progress on the event for all players. This method is only available to user accounts for your developer console. Only draft events can be reset. All resources that use the event will also be reset.

eventId.description: The ID of the event.

resetAll.description: Reset all player progress on all unpublished events for the currently authenticated player. This method is only accessible to whitelisted tester accounts for your application. All resources that use the events will also be reset.

reset.description: Reset all turn-based match data for a user. This method is only accessible to whitelisted tester accounts for your application.

description: The Management API for Google Play Game Services.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/games.description: Share your Google+ profile information and view and manage your game activity

category.description: Category that this advertiser belongs to. A valid list of categories can be found here: http://www.google.com/support/affiliatenetwork/advertiser/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=107581

epcSevenDayAverage.description: The sum of fees paid to publishers divided by the total number of clicks over the past seven days. This value should be multiplied by 100 at the time of display.

commissionDuration.description: The longest possible length of a commission (how long the cookies on the customer's browser last before they expire).

epcNinetyDayAverage.description: The sum of fees paid to publishers divided by the total number of clicks over the past three months. This value should be multiplied by 100 at the time of display.

contactEmail.description: Email that this advertiser would like publishers to contact them with.

payoutRank.description: A rank based on commissions paid to publishers over the past 90 days. A number between 1 and 4 where 4 means the top quartile (most money paid) and 1 means the bottom quartile (least money paid).

allowPublisherCreatedLinks.description: True if the advertiser allows publisher created links, otherwise false.

joinDate.description: Date that this advertiser was approved as a Google Affiliate Network advertiser.

CcOffer.description: A credit card offer. There are many possible result fields. We provide two different views of the data, or "projections." The "full" projection includes every result field. And the "summary" projection, which is the default, includes a smaller subset of the fields. The fields included in the summary projection are marked as such in their descriptions.

cashAdvanceTerms.description: Text describing the terms for cash advances. A summary field.

luggageInsurance.description: If you get coverage when you use the card for the given activity, this field describes it.

creditLimitMin.description: The low end for credit limits the issuer imposes on recipients of this card.

cardName.description: The issuer's name for the card, including any trademark or service mark designators. A summary field.

creditLimitMax.description: The high end for credit limits the issuer imposes on recipients of this card.

gracePeriodDisplay.description: Text describing the grace period before finance charges apply. A summary field.

offerId.description: This offer's ID. A summary field.

minPurchaseRate.description: The lowest interest rate the issuer charges on this card. Expressed as an absolute number, not as a percentage.

cardBenefits.description: A list of what the issuer thinks are the most important benefits of the card. Usually summarizes the rewards program, if there is one. A summary field.

category.description: The type of charge, for example Purchases.

maxRate.description: The highest rate the issuer may charge for defaulting on debt in this category. Expressed as an absolute number, not as a percentage.

minRate.description: The lowest rate the issuer may charge for defaulting on debt in this category. Expressed as an absolute number, not as a percentage.

defaultFees.description: Fees for defaulting on your payments.

offersImmediateCashReward.description: Whether a cash reward program lets you get cash back sooner than end of year or other longish period.

travelInsurance.description: If you get coverage when you use the card for the given activity, this field describes it.

returnedPaymentFee.description: Text describing the fee for a payment that doesn't clear. A summary field.

issuer.description: Name of card issuer. A summary field.

existingCustomerOnly.description: Whether this card is only available to existing customers of the issuer.

annualFeeDisplay.description: Text describing the annual fee, including any difference for the first year. A summary field.

initialSetupAndProcessingFee.description: Fee for setting up the card.

minimumFinanceCharge.description: Text describing how much missing the grace period will cost.

purchaseRateAdditionalDetails.description: Text describing any additional details for the purchase rate. A summary field.

rewardUnit.description: For cards with rewards programs, the unit of reward. For example, miles, cash back, points.

creditRatingDisplay.description: Text describing the credit ratings required for recipients of this card, for example "Excellent/Good." A summary field.

fraudLiability.description: If you get coverage when you use the card for the given activity, this field describes it.

prohibitedCategories.description: Categories in which the issuer does not wish the card to be displayed. A summary field.

landingPageUrl.description: The link to the issuer's page for this card. A summary field.

introCashAdvanceTerms.description: Text describing the terms for introductory period cash advances. A summary field.

firstYearAnnualFee.description: The annual fee for the first year, if different from the ongoing fee. Optional.

imageUrl.description: The link to the image of the card that is shown on Connect Commerce. A summary field.

introPurchaseTerms.description: Text describing the terms for introductory period purchases. A summary field.

category.description: The kind of purchases covered by this rule.

minRewardTier.description: The minimum purchase amount in the given category before this rule applies.

maxRewardTier.description: The maximum purchase amount in the given category for this rule to apply.

expirationMonths.description: How long rewards granted by this rule last.

amount.description: The number of units rewarded per purchase dollar.

additionalDetails.description: Other limits, for example, if this rule only applies during an introductory period.

rewards.description: For cards with rewards programs, detailed rules about how the program works.

extendedWarranty.description: If you get coverage when you use the card for the given activity, this field describes it.

kind.description: The kind for one credit card offer. A summary field.

trackingUrl.description: The link to ping to register a click on this offer. A summary field.

latePaymentFee.description: Text describing how much a late payment will cost, eg "up to $35." A summary field.

overLimitFee.description: Fee for exceeding the card's charge limit.

cardType.description: What kind of credit card this is, for example secured or unsecured.

approvedCategories.description: Possible categories for this card, eg "Low Interest" or "Good." A summary field.

introBalanceTransferTerms.description: Text describing the terms for introductory period balance transfers. A summary field.

annualRewardMaximum.description: The largest number of units you may accumulate in a year.

foreignCurrencyTransactionFee.description: Fee for each transaction involving a foreign currency.

annualFee.description: The ongoing annual fee, in dollars.

carRentalInsurance.description: If you get coverage when you use the card for the given activity, this field describes it.

variableRatesUpdateFrequency.description: How often variable rates are updated.

maxPurchaseRate.description: The highest interest rate the issuer charges on this card. Expressed as an absolute number, not as a percentage.

additionalCardBenefits.description: More marketing copy about the card's benefits. A summary field.

issuerWebsite.description: The generic link to the issuer's site.

balanceComputationMethod.description: Text describing how the balance is computed. A summary field.

aprDisplay.description: Text describing the purchase APR. A summary field.

additionalCardHolderFee.description: Any extra fees levied on card holders.

variableRatesLastUpdated.description: When variable rates were last updated.

ageMinimum.description: The youngest a recipient of this card may be.

network.description: Which network (eg Visa) the card belongs to. A summary field.

statementCopyFee.description: Fee for requesting a copy of your statement.

rewardsHaveBlackoutDates.description: For airline miles rewards, tells whether blackout dates apply to the miles.

emergencyInsurance.description: If you get coverage when you use the card for the given activity, this field describes it.

flightAccidentInsurance.description: If you get coverage when you use the card for the given activity, this field describes it.

rewardPartner.description: The company that redeems the rewards, if different from the issuer.

balanceTransferTerms.description: Text describing the terms for balance transfers. A summary field.

disclaimer.description: A notice that, if present, is referenced via an asterisk by many of the other summary fields. If this field is present, it will always start with an asterisk ("*"), and must be prominently displayed with the offer. A summary field.

issuerId.description: The Google Affiliate Network ID of the advertiser making this offer.

ageMinimumDetails.description: Text describing the details of the age minimum restriction.

amount.description: How many units of reward will be granted.

details.description: The circumstances under which this rule applies, for example, booking a flight via Orbitz.

bonusRewards.description: For cards with rewards programs, extra circumstances whereby additional rewards may be granted.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

title: Google Affiliate Network API

list.description: Retrieves data about all publishers that the requesting advertiser/publisher has access to.

publisherCategory.description: Caret(^) delimted list of publisher categories. Valid categories: (unclassified|community_and_content|shopping_and_promotion|loyalty_and_rewards|network|search_specialist|comparison_shopping|email). Filters out all publishers not in one of the given advertiser categories. Optional.

enumDescriptions: Publishers you've approved to your program.
Publishers available for you to recruit.
A publisher that you terminated from your program. Publishers also have the ability to remove themselves from your program.
A publisher that you did not approve to your program.
Publishers that have applied to your program. We recommend reviewing and deciding on pending publishers on a weekly basis.
relationshipStatus.description: Filters out all publishers for which do not have the given relationship status with the requesting publisher.

minSevenDayEpc.description: Filters out all publishers that have a seven day EPC average lower than the given value (inclusive). Min value 0.0. Optional.

minNinetyDayEpc.description: Filters out all publishers that have a ninety day EPC average lower than the given value (inclusive). Min value: 0.0. Optional.

pageToken.description: The value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous page. Optional.

role.description: The role of the requester. Valid values: 'advertisers' or 'publishers'.

The requester is requesting as a publisher.

maxResults.description: Max number of items to return in this page. Optional. Defaults to 20.

roleId.description: The ID of the requesting advertiser or publisher.

minPayoutRank.description: A value between 1 and 4, where 1 represents the quartile of publishers with the lowest ranks and 4 represents the quartile of publishers with the highest ranks. Filters out all publishers with a lower rank than the given quartile. For example if a 2 was given only publishers with a payout rank of 25 or higher would be included. Optional.

orderId.description: Caret(^) delimited list of order IDs. Filters out all events that do not reference one of the given order IDs. Optional.

sku.description: Caret(^) delimited list of SKUs. Filters out all events that do not reference one of the given SKU. Optional.

eventDateMax.description: Filters out all events later than given date. Optional. Defaults to 24 hours after eventMin.

status.description: Filters out all events that do not have the given status. Valid values: 'active', 'canceled'. Optional.

linkId.description: Caret(^) delimited list of link IDs. Filters out all events that do not reference one of the given link IDs. Optional.

modifyDateMin.description: Filters out all events modified earlier than given date. Optional. Defaults to 24 hours before the current modifyDateMax, if modifyDateMax is explicitly set.

eventDateMin.description: Filters out all events earlier than given date. Optional. Defaults to 24 hours from current date/time.

memberId.description: Caret(^) delimited list of member IDs. Filters out all events that do not reference one of the given member IDs. Optional.

maxResults.description: Max number of offers to return in this page. Optional. Defaults to 20.

advertiserId.description: Caret(^) delimited list of advertiser IDs. Filters out all events that do not reference one of the given advertiser IDs. Only used when under publishers role. Optional.

pageToken.description: The value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous page. Optional.

publisherId.description: Caret(^) delimited list of publisher IDs. Filters out all events that do not reference one of the given publishers IDs. Only used when under advertiser role. Optional.

role.description: The role of the requester. Valid values: 'advertisers' or 'publishers'.
enumDescriptions: The requester is requesting as an advertiser.
The requester is requesting as a publisher.

productCategory.description: Caret(^) delimited list of product categories. Filters out all events that do not reference a product in one of the given product categories. Optional.

enumDescriptions: A credit increases the publisher's payout amount and decreases the advertiser's invoice amount.
A debit reduces the publisher's payout and increases the advertiser's invoice amount.
A payment made to Google by an advertiser as a minimum monthly network fee.
A one time payment made from an advertiser to a publisher.
A payment from an advertiser to a publisher for the publisher maintaining a high tier level
chargeType.description: Filters out all charge events that are not of the given charge type. Valid values: 'other', 'slotting_fee', 'monthly_minimum', 'tier_bonus', 'credit', 'debit'. Optional.

roleId.description: The ID of the requesting advertiser or publisher.

modifyDateMax.description: Filters out all events modified later than given date. Optional. Defaults to 24 hours after modifyDateMin, if modifyDateMin is explicitly set.

enumDescriptions: The completion of an application, sign-up, or other process. For example, an action occurs if a user clicks an ad for a credit card and completes an application for that card.
A charge event is typically a payment between an advertiser, publisher or Google.
A conversion event, typically an e-commerce transaction. Some advertisers use a transaction to record other types of events, such as magazine subscriptions.
type.description: Filters out all events that are not of the given type. Valid values: 'action', 'transaction', 'charge'. Optional.

description: Lets you have programmatic access to your Google Affiliate Network data.
name: gan

md5Checksum.description: (M5) MD5 checksum of the sequence in the uppercase, excluding spaces but including pads as *.

format.description: The format for the exported data.

projectId.description: The Google Cloud project number that owns this export. This is the project that will be billed.

callsetIds.description: If provided, only variant call information from the specified callsets will be exported. By default all variant calls are exported.

bigqueryDataset.description: The BigQuery dataset to export data to. Note that this is distinct from the Genomics concept of "dataset". The caller must have WRITE access to this BigQuery dataset.

datasetId.description: Required. The ID of the dataset that contains variant data which should be exported. The caller must have READ access to this dataset.

bigqueryTable.description: The BigQuery table to export data to. The caller must have WRITE access to this BigQuery table.

version.description: (VN) Program version.

id.description: (ID) Program record identifier.

Call.description: A Call represents the determination of genotype with respect to a particular variant. It may include associated information such as quality and phasing. For example, a Call might assign a probability of 0.32 to the occurrence of a SNP named rs1234 in a callset with the name NA12345.

additionalProperties.description: A string which maps to an array of values.

info.description: A map of additional variant call information.

genotype.description: The genotype of this variant call. Each value represents either the value of the referenceBases field or a 1-based index into alternateBases. If a variant had a referenceBases field of "T" and an alternateBases value of ["A", "C"], and the genotype was [2, 1], that would mean the call represented the heterozygous value "CA" for this variant. If the genotype was instead [0, 1], the represented value would be "TA". Ordering of the genotype values is important if the phaseset field is present. If a genotype is not called (that is, a "." is present in the GT string) -1 is returned.

callsetId.description: The ID of the callset this variant call belongs to.

phaseset.description: If this field is present, this variant call's genotype ordering implies the phase of the bases and is consistent with any other variant calls on the same contig which have the same phaseset value. When importing data from VCF, if the genotype data was phased but no phase set was specified this field will be set to "*".

genotypeLikelihood.description: The genotype likelihoods for this variant call. Each array entry represents how likely a specific genotype is for this call. The value ordering is defined by the GL tag in the VCF spec.

callsetName.description: The name of the callset this variant call belongs to.

jobId.description: A job ID that can be used to get status information.

endPosition.description: Required. The end of the window (1-based, inclusive) for which overlapping variants should be returned.

startPosition.description: Required. The beginning of the window (1-based, inclusive) for which overlapping variants should be returned.

callsetNames.description: Only return variant calls which belong to callsets which have exactly these names. Leaving this blank returns all variant calls. At most one of callsetNames or callsetIds should be provided.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of variants to return.

pageToken.description: The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets. To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of "nextPageToken" from the previous response.

callsetIds.description: Only return variant calls which belong to callsets with these ids. Leaving this blank returns all variant calls. At most one of callsetNames or callsetIds should be provided.

variantName.description: Only return variants which have exactly this name.

contig.description: Required. Only return variants on this contig.

datasetId.description: Required. The ID of the dataset to search.

Dataset.description: A Dataset is a collection of genomic data.

projectId.description: The Google Developers Console project number that this dataset belongs to.

isPublic.description: Flag indicating whether or not a dataset is publicly viewable. If a dataset is not public, it inherits viewing permissions from its project.

id.description: The Google generated ID of the dataset, immutable.

sourceUris.description: A list of URIs pointing at VCF files in Google Cloud Storage. See the VCF Specification for more details on the input format.

datasetId.description: Required. The dataset to which variant data should be imported.

Metadata.description: Metadata describes a single piece of variant call metadata. These data include a top level key and either a single value string (value) or a list of key-value pairs (info.) Value and info are mutually exclusive.

additionalProperties.description: A string which maps to an array of values.

description.description: A textual description of this metadata.

number.description: The number of values that can be included in a field described by this metadata.

value.description: The value field for simple metadata

key.description: The top-level key.

type.description: The type of data. Possible types include: Integer, Float, Flag, Character, and String.

id.description: User-provided ID field, not enforced by this API. Two or more pieces of structured metadata with identical id and key fields are considered equivalent.

ContigBound.description: ContigBound records an upper bound for the starting coordinate of variants in a particular contig.

contig.description: The contig the bound is associate with.

upperBound.description: An upper bound (inclusive) on the starting coordinate of any variant in the contig.

Read.description: A Read is a group of bases that may or may not have been aligned to a reference. It contains quality information and other metadata.

mateReferenceSequenceName.description: The name of the sequence that the paired read is aligned to. This is usually the same as referenceSequenceName. (RNEXT)

baseQuality.description: Represents the quality of each base in this read. Each character represents one base. To get the quality, take the ASCII value of the character and subtract 33. (QUAL)

templateLength.description: Length of the original piece of DNA that produced both this read and the paired read. (TLEN)

name.description: The name of the read. When imported from a BAM file, this is the query template name. (QNAME)

mappingQuality.description: A score up to 255 that represents how likely this read's aligned position is to be correct. A higher value is better. (MAPQ)

cigar.description: A condensed representation of how this read matches up to the reference. (CIGAR)

matePosition.description: The 1-based start position of the paired read. (PNEXT)

readsetId.description: The ID of the readset this read belongs to.

flags.description: Each bit of this number has a different meaning if enabled. See the full BAM spec for more details. (FLAG)

alignedBases.description: The originalBases after the cigar field has been applied. Deletions are represented with '-' and insertions are omitted.

position.description: The 1-based start position of the aligned read. If the first base starts at the very beginning of the reference sequence, then the position would be '1'. (POS)

referenceSequenceName.description: The name of the sequence that this read is aligned to. This would be, for example, 'X' for the X Chromosome or '20' for Chromosome 20. (RNAME)

originalBases.description: The list of bases that this read represents (such as "CATCGA"). (SEQ)

id.description: The Google generated ID of the read, immutable.

additionalProperties.description: A string which maps to an array of values.

tags.description: A map of additional read information. (TAG)

HeaderSection.description: The header section of the BAM/SAM file.

fileUri.description: The file URI that this data was imported from.

pairedSourceUris.description: A list of Google Cloud Storage URIs of paired end .fastq files to operate upon. If specified, this represents the second file of each paired .fastq file. The first file of each pair should be specified in "sourceUris".

projectId.description: Required. The Google Cloud Project ID with which to associate the request.

align.description: Specifies whether or not to run the alignment pipeline. At least one of align or call_variants must be provided.

callVariants.description: Specifies whether or not to run the variant calling pipeline. If specified, alignment will be performed first and the aligned BAMs will passed as input to the variant caller. At least one of align or call_variants must be provided.

sourceUris.description: A list of Google Cloud Storage URIs of data files to operate upon. These can be .bam, interleaved .fastq, or paired .fastq. If specifying paired .fastq files, the first of each pair of files should be listed here, and the second of each pair should be listed in "pairedSourceUris".

gcsOutputPath.description: Specifies where to copy the results of certain pipelines. This shoud be in the form of "gs://bucket/path".

Variant.description: A Variant represents a change in DNA sequence relative to some reference. For example, a Variant could represent a SNP or an insertion. Variants belong to a Dataset.

additionalProperties.description: A string which maps to an array of values.

info.description: A map of additional variant information.

end.description: The end position (1-based) of this variant. This corresponds to the first base after the last base in the reference allele. So, the length of the reference allele is (end - position). This is useful for variants that don't explicitly give alternate bases, for example large deletions.

calls.description: The variant calls for this particular variant. Each one represents the determination of genotype with respect to this variant.

created.description: The date this variant was created, in milliseconds from the epoch.

id.description: The Google generated ID of the variant, immutable.

names.description: Names for the variant, for example a RefSNP ID.

alternateBases.description: The bases that appear instead of the reference bases.

position.description: The position at which this variant occurs (1-based). This corresponds to the first base of the string of reference bases.

contig.description: The contig on which this variant occurs. (such as 'chr20' or 'X')

referenceBases.description: The reference bases for this variant. They start at the given position.

datasetId.description: The ID of the dataset this variant belongs to.

Job.description: A Job represents an ongoing process that can be monitored for status information.

status.description: The status of this job.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during processing.

description.description: A more detailed description of this job's current status.

warnings.description: Any warnings that occurred during processing.

projectId.description: The Google Developers Console project number to which this job belongs.

created.description: The date this job was created, in milliseconds from the epoch.

importedIds.description: If this Job represents an import, this field will contain the IDs of the objects that were successfully imported.

id.description: The job ID.

nextPageToken.description: The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets. Provide this value in a subsequent request to return the next page of results. This field will be empty if there aren't any additional results.

Beacon.description: A beacon represents whether any variant call in a dataset has a specific allele at a particular position.

exists.description: True if the allele exists on any variant call, false otherwise.

Readset.description: A Readset is a collection of Reads.

fileData.description: File information from the original BAM import. See the BAM format specification for additional information on each field.

id.description: The Google generated ID of the readset, immutable.

datasetId.description: The ID of the dataset this readset belongs to.

name.description: The readset name, typically this is the sample name.

Callset.description: A Callset is a collection of Variant Calls. It belongs to a Dataset.

additionalProperties.description: A string which maps to an array of values.

info.description: A map of additional callset information.

created.description: The date this callset was created in milliseconds from the epoch.

datasetId.description: The ID of the dataset this callset belongs to.

id.description: The Google generated ID of the callset, immutable.

jobId.description: A job ID that can be used to get status information.

nextPageToken.description: The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets. Provide this value in a subsequent request to return the next page of results. This field will be empty if there aren't any additional results.

status.description: Only return jobs which have a matching status.

createdAfter.description: If specified, only jobs created on or after this date, given in milliseconds since Unix epoch, will be returned.

projectId.description: Required. Only return jobs which belong to this Google Developers Console project. Only accepts project numbers.

maxResults.description: Specifies the number of results to return in a single page. Defaults to 128. The maximum value is 256.

pageToken.description: The continuation token which is used to page through large result sets. To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of the "nextPageToken" from the previous response.

createdBefore.description: If specified, only jobs created prior to this date, given in milliseconds since Unix epoch, will be returned.

readsetIds.description: The IDs of the readsets to export.

exportUri.description: A Google Cloud Storage URI where the exported BAM file will be created. The currently authenticated user must have write access to the new file location. An error will be returned if the URI already contains data.

projectId.description: The Google Developers Console project number that owns this export. This is the project that will be billed.

sourceUris.description: A list of URIs pointing at BAM files in Google Cloud Storage.

datasetId.description: Required. The ID of the dataset these readsets will belong to. The caller must have WRITE permissions to this dataset.

jobId.description: A job ID that can be used to get status information.

nextPageToken.description: The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets. Provide this value in a subsequent request to return the next page of results. This field will be empty if there aren't any additional results.

pageToken.description: The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets. To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of "nextPageToken" from the previous response.

datasetIds.description: Restricts this query to readsets within the given datasets. At least one ID must be provided.

name.description: Only return readsets for which a substring of the name matches this string.

maxResults.description: Specifies number of results to return in a single page. If unspecified, it will default to 128. The maximum value is 256.

nextPageToken.description: The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets. Provide this value in a subsequent request to return the next page of results. This field will be empty if there aren't any additional results.

pageToken.description: The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets. To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of "nextPageToken" from the previous response.

datasetIds.description: Restrict the query to callsets within the given datasets. At least one ID must be provided.

name.description: Only return callsets for which a substring of the name matches this string.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of callsets to return.

contigBounds.description: A list of all contigs used by the variants in a dataset with associated coordinate upper bounds for each one.

metadata.description: The metadata associated with this dataset.

jobId.description: A job ID that can be used to get status information.
A job ID that can be used to get status information.

version.description: (VN) BAM format version.

nextPageToken.description: The continuation token which is used to page through large result sets. Provide this value is a subsequent request to return the next page of results. This field will be empty if there are no more results.

jobs.description: The list of jobs results, ordered newest to oldest.

sequencingCenterName.description: (CN) Name of sequencing center producing the read.

description.description: (DS) Description.

processingProgram.description: (PG) Programs used for processing the read group.

flowOrder.description: (FO) Flow order. The array of nucleotide bases that correspond to the nucleotides used for each flow of each read.

sequencingTechnology.description: (PL) Platform/technology used to produce the reads.

date.description: (DT) Date the run was produced (ISO8601 date or date/time).

keySequence.description: (KS) The array of nucleotide bases that correspond to the key sequence of each read.

id.description: (ID) Read group identifier.

sequenceStart.description: The start position (1-based, inclusive) of the target range. If specified, "sequenceName" must also be specified. Defaults to the start of the target reference sequence, if any.

readsetIds.description: The readsets within which to search for reads. At least one readset ID must be provided. All specified readsets must be aligned against a common set of reference sequences; this defines the genomic coordinates for the query.

sequenceEnd.description: The end position (1-based, inclusive) of the target range. If specified, "sequenceName" must also be specified. Defaults to the end of the target reference sequence, if any.

maxResults.description: Specifies number of results to return in a single page. If unspecified, it will default to 256. The maximum value is 1024.

pageToken.description: The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets. To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of "nextPageToken" from the previous response.

sequenceName.description: Restricts the results to a particular reference sequence such as '1', 'chr1', or 'X'. The set of valid references sequences depends on the readsets specified. If set to "*", only unmapped Reads are returned.

nextPageToken.description: The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets. Provide this value in a subsequent request to return the next page of results. This field will be empty if there aren't any additional results.

reads.description: The list of matching Reads. The resulting Reads are sorted by position; the smallest positions are returned first. Unmapped reads, which have no position, are returned last and are further sorted alphabetically by name.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

title: Genomics API

get.description: Gets a dataset by ID.

datasetId.description: The ID of the dataset.

undelete.description: Undeletes a dataset by restoring a dataset which was deleted via this API. This operation is only possible for a week after the deletion occurred.

datasetId.description: The ID of the dataset to be undeleted.

list.description: Lists all datasets.

pageToken.description: The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets. To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of "nextPageToken" from the previous response.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of results returned by this request.

projectId.description: Only return datasets which belong to this Google Developers Console project. Only accepts project numbers.

update.description: Updates a dataset.

datasetId.description: The ID of the dataset to be updated.

patch.description: Updates a dataset. This method supports patch semantics.

datasetId.description: The ID of the dataset to be updated.
The ID of the dataset to be deleted.

search.description: Gets a list of jobs matching the criteria.

patch.description: Updates a readset. This method supports patch semantics.

readsetId.description: The ID of the readset to be updated. The caller must have WRITE permissions to the dataset associated with this readset.

export.description: Exports readsets to a BAM file in Google Cloud Storage. Note that currently there may be some differences between exported BAM files and the original BAM file at the time of import. In particular, comments in the input file header will not be preserved, and some custom tags will be converted to strings.

import.description: Creates readsets by asynchronously importing the provided information. Note that currently comments in the input file header are not imported and some custom tags will be converted to strings, rather than preserving tag types. The caller must have WRITE permissions to the dataset.

readsetId.description: The ID of the readset to be deleted. The caller must have WRITE permissions to the dataset associated with this readset.

get.description: This is an experimental API that provides a Global Alliance for Genomics and Health Beacon. It may change at any time.

allele.description: Required. The allele to look for ('A', 'C', 'G' or 'T').

contig.description: Required. The contig to query over.

datasetId.description: The ID of the dataset to query over. It must be public. Private datasets will return an unauthorized exception.

position.description: Required. The 1-based position to query at.

search.description: Gets a list of callsets matching the criteria.

get.description: Gets a callset by ID.

update.description: Updates a callset.

callsetId.description: The ID of the callset to be updated.

patch.description: Updates a callset. This method supports patch semantics.

callsetId.description: The ID of the callset to be updated.
The ID of the callset to be deleted.

search.description: Gets a list of reads for one or more readsets. Reads search operates over a genomic coordinate space of reference sequence & position defined over the reference sequences to which the requested readsets are aligned. If a target positional range is specified, search returns all reads whose alignment to the reference genome overlap the range. A query which specifies only readset IDs yields all reads in those readsets, including unmapped reads. All reads returned (including reads on subsequent pages) are ordered by genomic coordinate (reference sequence & position). Reads with equivalent genomic coordinates are returned in a deterministic order.
Gets a list of variants matching the criteria.

export.description: Exports variant data to an external destination.

getSummary.description: Gets a summary of all the variant data in a dataset.

variantId.description: The ID of the variant to be deleted.

create.description: Creates and asynchronously runs an ad-hoc job. This is an experimental call and may be removed or changed at any time.

name.description: The name of the header before the : separator. For example, To.

value.description: The value of the header after the : separator. For example, someuser@example.com.

History.description: A record of a change to the user's mailbox. Each history contains a list of the messages that were affected by this change.

messages.description: The messages that changed in this history record.

id.description: The mailbox sequence ID.

MessagePartBody.description: The body of a single MIME message part.

attachmentId.description: When present, contains the ID of an external attachment that can be retrieved in a separate messages.attachments.get request. When not present, the entire content of the message part body is contained in the data field.

data.description: The body data of a MIME message part. May be empty for MIME container types that have no message body or when the body data is sent as a separate attachment. An attachment ID is present if the body data is contained in a separate attachment.

size.description: Total number of bytes in the body of the message part.

Thread.description: A collection of messages representing a conversation.

snippet.description: A short part of the message text.

messages.description: The list of messages in the thread.

id.description: The unique ID of the thread.

historyId.description: The ID of the last history record that modified this thread.

nextPageToken.description: Page token to retrieve the next page of results in the list.

addLabelIds.description: A list of IDs of labels to add to this thread.

removeLabelIds.description: A list of IDs of labels to remove from this thread.

nextPageToken.description: Token to retrieve the next page of results in the list.

Draft.description: A draft email in the user's mailbox.

message.description: The message content of the draft.

id.description: The immutable ID of the draft.

body.description: The message part body for this part, which may be empty for container MIME message parts.

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the message part.

partId.description: The immutable ID of the message part.

filename.description: The filename of the attachment. Only present if this message part represents an attachment.

headers.description: List of headers on this message part. For the top-level message part, representing the entire message payload, it will contain the standard RFC 2822 email headers such as To, From, and Subject.

parts.description: The child MIME message parts of this part. This only applies to container MIME message parts, for example multipart/*. For non- container MIME message part types, such as text/plain, this field is empty. For more information, see RFC 1521.

nextPageToken.description: Page token to retrieve the next page of results in the list.

historyId.description: The ID of the mailbox's current history record.
The ID of the last history record that modified this message.

id.description: The immutable ID of the message.

snippet.description: A short part of the message text.

raw.description: The entire email message in an RFC 2822 formatted and URL-safe base64 encoded string. Returned in messages.get and drafts.get responses when the format=RAW parameter is supplied.

sizeEstimate.description: Estimated size in bytes of the message.

threadId.description:
The ID of the thread the message belongs to. To add a message or draft to a thread, the following criteria must be met: 
- The requested threadId must be specified on the Message or Draft.Message you supply with your request. 
- The References and In-Reply-To headers must be set in compliance with the <a href="https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2822"RFC 2822 standard. 
- The Subject headers must match.

labelIds.description: List of IDs of labels applied to this message.

payload.description: The parsed email structure in the message parts.

Label.description: Labels are used to categorize messages and threads within the user's mailbox.

messageListVisibility.description: The visibility of the label in the message list in the Gmail web interface.

labelListVisibility.description: The visibility of the label in the label list in the Gmail web interface.

type.description: The owner type for the label. User labels are created by the user and can be modified and deleted by the user and can be applied to any message or thread. System labels are internally created and cannot be added, modified, or deleted. System labels may be able to be applied to or removed from messages and threads under some circumstances but this is not guaranteed. For example, users can apply and remove the INBOX and UNREAD labels from messages and threads, but cannot apply or remove the DRAFTS or SENT labels from messages or threads.

name.description: The display name of the label.

removeLabelIds.description: A list IDs of labels to remove from this message.

startHistoryId.description: Required. Returns history records after the specified startHistoryId. The supplied startHistoryId should be obtained from the historyId of a message, thread, or previous list response. History IDs increase chronologically but are not contiguous with random gaps in between valid IDs. Supplying an invalid or out of date startHistoryId typically returns an HTTP 404 error code. A historyId is typically valid for at least a week, but in some circumstances may be valid for only a few hours. If you receive an HTTP 404 error response, your application should perform a full sync. If you receive no nextPageToken in the response, there are no updates to retrieve and you can store the returned historyId for a future request.

NewDisk.description: A Persistent Disk resource that will be created and attached to each Replica in the Pool. Each Replica will have a unique persistent disk that is created and attached to that Replica.

boot.description: If true, indicates that this is the root persistent disk.

initializeParams.description: Create the new disk using these parameters. The name of the disk will be <instance_name>-<five_random_charactersgt;.

attachment.description: How the disk will be attached to the Replica.

autoDelete.description: If true, then this disk will be deleted when the instance is deleted.

ports.description: List of ports or port ranges (Example inputs include: ["22"], [?33?, "12345-12349"].

Tag.description: A Compute Engine Instance tag, identical to the tags on the corresponding Compute Engine Instance resource.

healthChecks.description: The Health Checks to configure for the ReplicaPoolModule

resourceView.description: [Output Only] The name of the Resource View associated with a ReplicaPoolModule. This field will be generated by the service.

numReplicas.description: Number of replicas in this module.

additionalProperties.description: Name of the environment variable. The name must conform to the following regular expression: [a-zA-Z_]+[a-zA-Z0-9_]+.

DiskAttachment.description: How to attach a disk to a Replica.

deviceName.description: The device name of this disk.

index.description: A zero-based index to assign to this disk, where 0 is reserved for the boot disk. If not specified, this is assigned by the server.

description: The Deployment Manager API allows users to declaratively configure, deploy and run complex solutions on the Google Cloud Platform.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/appengin.description: View and manage your applications deployed on Google App Engine

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ndev.clo.description: View your Google Cloud Platform management resources and deployment status information
View and manage your Google Cloud Platform management resources and deployment status information

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/devstora.description: Manage your data in Google Cloud Storage

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-pl.description: View and manage your data across Google Cloud Platform services

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/compute.description: View and manage your Google Compute Engine resources
